Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/x) Product Analytics
Description:
Job Description

We at sevDesk:

We at sevDesk don't have a universal formula for happiness in the world of work either, but we work together every day to understand exactly what can permanently increase our sevFamily's sense of happiness. One thing is for sure: with us, you can be exactly who you are and work in a way that suits you and your needs! It's not the work that defines us, it's us that define the work!

Our culture is not artificial, it is real. Be yourself at sevDesk - BE YOURSEV!

Your mission:

You are an analytical consultant for the data- and insights-driven development of our product portfolio. With your analyses, you identify growth potential and influence our product roadmap with your recommendations for action.

Here's how you'll make an impact:


You drive analytics initiatives that inform product strategy, user growth, and engagement optimization, ensuring alignment between data outputs and business priorities.
You translate data into clear, impactful insights for product and marketing teams to guide feature development and customer experience improvements.
You‚ÄØdevelop actionable insights through powerful visualizations, cohort analysis, etc. supporting experimentation, lifecycle management, and personalization efforts.
You lead and own the implementation of data collection and product experimentation, establishing rigorous methodologies and clear metrics frameworks.
You mentor peer analysts and stakeholders in best practices for data interpretation, dashboarding, and storytelling, driving a data-first product culture.


Your Qualification:


You have at least 5 years of experience in the digital environment. You have already worked as a Data Analyst (m/f/x) for at least 3 years and have mentored other analysts.
You have a degree in (business) informatics, economics, (business) mathematics,‚ÄØcomputer science, or comparable.
You have at least 2 years of application experience in SQL and a good technical understanding of common data modelling techniques such as Kimball‚Äôs Dimensional Modelling and/or OBT.
You have experience in the use of business intelligence tools (e.g. Looker, Power BI, Tableau) and analytics tools (e.g. Mixpanel, Amplitude, Google Analytics).
You have relevant experience in the conception and evaluation of A/B tests, a functional knowledge of statistical testing‚ÄØtechniques is a plus.


Our Techstack: SQL | Snowflake | dbt | Python | Looker | Metabase | Mixpanel

Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a stock option plan and company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you‚Äôre most productive, whether that‚Äôs at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: learning budget, bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, ‚Ä¶), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!

For more insights, visit us on Instagram



Contact:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Marc Riehle
Show more

  • You have experience in the use of business intelligence tools (e.g. Looker, Power BI, Tableau) and analytics tools (e.g. Mixpanel, Amplitude, Google Analytics).
  • You have relevant experience in the conception and evaluation of A/B tests, a functional knowledge of statistical testing‚ÄØtechniques is a plus.

Our Techstack: SQL | Snowflake | dbt | Python | Looker | Metabase | Mixpanel

Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a stock option plan and company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you‚Äôre most productive, whether that‚Äôs at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: learning budget, bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, ‚Ä¶), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!

For more insights, visit us on Instagram



Contact:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Marc Riehle

Title: Data Analysis, Manager
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Mid-Level Data Analyst who transforms data into stories that drive impact.

In this role, you‚Äôll turn complex numbers into clear insights that shape our strategies across social media, influencer marketing, and paid media. From smart visualizations to AI-powered insights‚Äîyou‚Äôll help us sharpen campaigns and consultancy offerings alike.




If you love clean data, clear insights, and creative collaboration, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.


Tasks



You analyze campaign and social media performance, extracting actionable insights to support strategic decision-making


You utilize tools like Pulsar, GWI, and Captiv8 and and you analyze social media data from platforms like TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube via APIs, surfacing insights and emerging patterns


You collaborate with Strategy, Creative and Paid Media teams to deliver integrated, data-driven recommendations and to turn insights into user-friendly recommendations and narratives


You structure raw data for scalable outputs, create clear reports and dashboards, including social listening, competitor analysis and benchmarks


You contribute to the development of the Social Media Value (SMV) model


You support data model prototyping, including scoring logic, audience clustering, and predictive insights



Requirements



Driven. Passionate. Diverse. Equal. These are values you cherish


You have at least 3 years of experience in data analytics, ideally within a digital, SaaS, or social media-focused environment


You have a good understanding of social media metrics and you are comfortable working with APIs and large datasets from social platforms


You can create clear visualizations and present insights effectively (e.g., via Looker Studio, Tableau, or similar)


You are analytical and detail-oriented, with a structured mindset and a curiosity for uncovering patterns


You can effectively communicate and pitch ideas in English and any additional language is highly valued in our international environment



Benefits



Time to pack your bags for London, Milan, Paris, Hamburg or Berlin: you‚Äôre welcome to work abroad from any of our international office locations


We love to see you grow: our careers coach is on hand for one-to-one coaching sessions and team workshops


We work hard and play hard, bringing our global team together to collaborate, learn from one another and celebrate our successes


Don‚Äôt fancy the office today? Our hybrid remote policy lets you work from home two days a week


Keep your commute to a minimum: you‚Äôll find all our offices right in the city centre


For motivational high-paws and comforting cuddles, your four-legged friend is absolutely welcome at our offices

Title: Senior Data Analyst (d/f/m) - People Analytics
Description:
Our Story

Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.

Spread across Germany, Spain and the UK, the team at Taxfix Group with its brands Taxfix, Steuerbot and TaxScouts, is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with over 400 professionals, including tax experts, developers, and IT security experts, we're rich in ideas and voices. The group has facilitated more than 3.5 billion euros in tax refunds for its customers since its founding in 2016

Your Challenge

At Taxfix, we believe that data-driven decision-making is key to creating a thriving workplace. As a Senior People Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in transforming People data into strategic insights that drive business impact. Your expertise in analytics, forecasting, and visualization will enable our leadership team to make informed decisions about workforce planning, staff costs, and people strategies. You‚Äôll collaborate with key stakeholders, ensure data quality, and empower the People team with self-service analytics capabilities‚Äîhelping us shape an even stronger, more data-savvy organization.

Your Responsibilities


Develop analytics, reporting, and dashboards that support decision-making and continuous improvements, delivering regular and ad-hoc reports with actionable insights.
Drive workforce planning and staff cost forecasting in collaboration with Finance, ensuring accurate and reliable budget projections.
Engage with stakeholders across the organization to identify reporting and analytics needs, conducting in-depth analyses to define and document actionable requirements.
Work closely with the leadership team and People Business Partners to assess and develop workforce diagnostics, helping to align people strategies and decision-making with business goals.
Identify and address inconsistencies in people data by working with cross-functional teams, improving data quality, reliability and usability.
Present insights using impactful data visualizations, turning complex data into compelling narratives that drive action.
Develop documentation and training materials to empower People team stakeholders to independently generate reports and dashboards, reducing dependency on centralized analytics support.


Your Profile


4+ years of experience in data analysis, with proficiency in Python, SQL, Google Sheets, App Scripts, and other analytical tools.
Hands-on experience (3+ years) in dashboard and data visualization development, using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, and other BI tools as well as data modelling and dbt knowledge.
Demonstrated experience in building forecasting models for workforce planning and staff cost projections.
4+ years of experience in creating reports and executive summaries for HR and business leadership, driving strategic impact.
Excellent storytelling and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with senior stakeholders and translate data into business insights.
Experience in working with executives and addressing senior leaders' needs in a clear, concise, and actionable way.
Deep understanding of people analytics and metrics, with at least 4 years of experience leveraging data to drive business impact.
Proven track record in improving data quality through monitoring, quality control measures, and reporting.
Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.


Why Taxfix?


A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals.
Holistic well-being with free mental health coaching sessions and yoga.
A monthly allowance to spend on an extensive range of services that you can use and roll over as flexibly as you like.
Employee stock options for all employees‚Äîbecause everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create.
30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours.
A generous learning budget to support your personal and professional development and guidance from our internal L&D experts.
Work from abroad for up to six weeks every year. Just align with your team, and then enjoy your trip.
Plenty of opportunities to socialise as a team. In addition to internal meetups, our international team hosts regular get-togethers‚Äîvirtually and in person when possible.
Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix app‚Äîand internal support for all personal tax-related questions.
Have a four-legged friend in your life? We‚Äôre happy to have dogs join us in the office.


Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture.

At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyway. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't considered previously.

Title: Senior Tracking Specialist (F/M/D)
Description:
Company Description

Join one of the world‚Äôs largest and most innovative digital real estate tech companies.

Backed by global investment leaders KKR and CPP Investments, AVIV Group is redefining how people buy, sell, rent, and value property across Europe and the Middle East. With a strong presence in France, Germany, Belgium, and Israel, we‚Äôre behind some of the region‚Äôs most iconic digital real estate platforms ‚Äî including SeLoger , Immowelt , Immoweb , Meilleurs Agents (France‚Äôs leading property valuation platform), Yad2 (Israel‚Äôs #1 classifieds site), and Homeday, one of Germany‚Äôs fastest-growing proptechs.

Our mission? To simplify life‚Äôs most valuable transactions. We bring together data, technology, and human insight to empower millions of people to unlock their perfect place!

Join us in shaping the future of real estate.

Job Description

As Senior Tracking Specialist, within the Data Division, you will play a critical role in ensuring accurate and comprehensive tracking of business-critical events, across our various digital platforms. You‚Äôll act as the technical expert of the tracking infrastructure, collaborating closely with Data Analysts, Developers, Product Managers, and the Performance Marketing team to guarantee top-tier data collection and that all tracking requirements are accurately captured and fulfilled.

We are looking for someone who can :


Own the implementation, configuration, and maintenance of Google Tag Manager (GTM), Google Analytics 4 (GA4), ideally Adjust (MMP) and other tracking tools.
Translate stakeholder requirements into scalable tracking specifications & solutions using best practices.
Collaborate closely with developers to ensure correct Data Layer implementation.
Create and manage complex tags, triggers, and variables in GTM for GA4 and our media partners (Meta, TikTok, Google Ads, etc.)
Guarantee the quality of our data by establishing, improving and automating the QA processes.
Develop a strategy to convert from a client-side to a server-side and first-party data setup and ensure seamless integration and privacy compliance.
Validate data flows starting from the Data Layer through GTM to GA 4 and our media partners by using tools such as GTM Preview, GA4 DebugView, and browser consoles.
Ensure the integrity of the tracking plan through proper version control and QA sign-offs.
Implement best practices and governance policies across all tracking setups to improve AVIV data collection.
Serve as the main contact for all tracking-related questions from P&T, Data Analytics, and Performance Marketing.


Qualifications

What we are expecting from you :


Several years of Proven experience with client- and server-side tracking
Expert in Google Tag Manager (GTM), Google Analytics 4 (GA4), and media pixel integrations
Strong understanding of web/app architecture and Data Layer concepts.
Proficient in CSS, HTML and JavaScript for implementing advanced tracking solutions.
In-depth knowledge of privacy regulations and cookie-less tracking
A mindset for data quality, governance, and scalable implementation.


Additional Information

NEXT STEPS:

Unlock your perfect job with us today and make an application. The recruitment process includes:


Phone call with recruiter (expectations and circumstances)
Hiring Manager Interview
Case study
Interview with Stakeholders
Conclusion


BENEFITS:


30 days annual leave
Hybrid or remote working options
Flexible working hours
Company pension scheme
‚Ç¨50 public transport allowance
‚Ç¨100 allowance for glasses
A mix of Health and Wellbeing benefits
Bicycle leasing (Job Rad)
Berlin only - Subsidised canteen
Charity fundraisers


At AVIV, we are an equal opportunities employer and an organisation where everyone is welcomed to be their authentic selves. We strongly encourage individuals with visible and non visible disabilities, all educational backgrounds, people from minority backgrounds, those from the LGBTQIA+ community and parents and carers to apply. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, or wish to discuss part time or flexible working requirements, please let us know.In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Our ambition is to be the leading Employer in PropTech across Europe and this is a pivotal time to join us and unlock your perfect job!

Title: (Associate) Consultant Business Intelligence & Data Analytics (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir bei Capgemini Invent glauben, dass unterschiedliche Perspektiven den Wandel vorantreiben. Als innovative Transformationsberater vereinen wir unsere strategischen, kreativen und wissenschaftlichen F√§higkeiten und arbeiten eng mit unseren Kunden zusammen, um zukunftsweisende L√∂sungen zu entwickeln. Hilf uns dabei, den Wandel voranzutreiben, der auf die Herausforderungen unserer Kunden von heute und morgen zugeschnitten ist. Informiert und validiert durch Wissenschaft und Daten. Title: Data Engineer - Quant Research- Hedge Fund - $350k
Company: Paragon Alpha - Hedge Fund Talent Business
Description:
Paragon are partnered with a systematic hedge fund trading quant equities and credit, who rely on data driven processes to inform their strategies.




The role requires scaling and augmenting a research data platform, and helping to create a system that can integrate vast and disparate data-sets into one locations, allowing Quant Researchers to easily access.




Stack: Python, AWS, Airflow, ETL




The team is partnering with tier one Quant Traders and Researchers, and would allow you to push yourself technically and professionally. They need an excellent technologist with a trading background, and some who can understand the data quants need and why.




If you would like the chance to work with some of the worlds best technologists and investment professionals, then please do apply.

Title: Junior Data Engineer (Remote)
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

dbt Labs is a leading analytics engineering platform that helps data teams transform raw data into actionable insights. As a Data Engineer, you will design, build, and maintain core components of the data ecosystem, enabling analytics and improving operational efficiency across the business. This role involves collaboration with various stakeholders to deliver sustainable data solutions and enhance data infrastructure.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Design, build, and maintain reliable, scalable data pipelines using dbt to support analytics and operational use cases.

‚Ä¢ Implement and enforce standards that ensure high data quality, consistency, and reliability across our internal data ecosystem.

‚Ä¢ Optimize query performance, manage compute costs, and ensure low-latency data access for downstream users.

‚Ä¢ Continuously evaluate and enhance existing systems, proactively identifying and resolving technical debt and bottlenecks.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with analysts, business stakeholders, and engineers to understand data requirements and deliver relevant and sustainable solutions.

‚Ä¢ Build automation into data workflows to reduce manual overhead and improve data freshness, lineage tracking, and monitoring.

‚Ä¢ Provide product feedback by ‚Äúdogfooding‚Äù new data infrastructure and AI technology.




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ Are an expert in SQL and Python

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience as a data engineer, and 4+ years of total experience in software engineering (including data engineering roles)

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in at least one additional core Data Engineering language such as Scala, Java or Rust

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with modern orchestration tools like Airflow, Dagster, or Prefect

‚Ä¢ A bias for action‚Äîable to stay focused and prioritize effectively




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Experience developing and scaling dbt projects

‚Ä¢ Have worked in a SaaS or high-growth tech environment

‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of open table formats (such as Apache Iceberg)




Company:

dbt Labs is a data analytics software company that develops tools for transforming and managing data within cloud data warehouses. Founded in 2016, the company is headquartered in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA, with a team of 501-1000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. dbt Labs has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Description

JPI is hiring a Data Engineer to support federal clients in designing and implementing scalable data pipelines, cloud-native architectures, and modern data platforms that drive mission impact. This role plays a key part in our clients‚Äô efforts to become data-driven organizations‚Äîturning fragmented, siloed data into structured insights using best-in-class technologies like AWS, Databricks, and Python-based frameworks. The ideal candidate combines technical expertise with a consulting mindset, capable of working across teams to translate data strategy into actionable solutions.

The Data Engineer will be responsible for architecting ingestion pipelines, transforming large datasets, and enabling advanced analytics across cloud and hybrid environments. This includes working with structured and unstructured data, integrating APIs, and building out high-performance data pipelines using Databricks and Spark. The role involves close collaboration with analysts, developers, and mission stakeholders to ensure solutions are agile, secure, and aligned with evolving priorities.

At JPI, we strive to empower our people and excel for our clients. We hold ourselves to high standards and prioritize our values of being one team with unwavering integrity. We are motivated by our mission and driven to deliver solutions that exceed expectations. Will you join us?

Responsibilities Include

Project Planning / Management


Participate in Agile ceremonies including sprint planning, daily standups, and retrospectives.
Support the development of technical documentation and briefing materials for leadership.
Collaborate with clients and internal teams to align data architecture with business and mission goals.
Track and maintain technical deliverables, action items, and project risks.


Solution Development & Integration


Lead the design and implementation of modern, scalable data pipelines (ETL/ELT) using cloud-native tooling.
Design and implement scalable data pipelines and transformations using Databricks on cloud platforms.
Migrate and modernize legacy data platforms to AWS (or other major cloud providers).
Build reliable ingestion mechanisms for batch and real-time data.
Integrate datasets across disparate platforms using APIs and custom connectors.
Develop robust data models and schema designs for both transactional and warehouse systems.
Provide expertise in system integration, database design, and performance optimization.


Cloud Infrastructure & Programming


Architect and implement cloud-based data platforms (preferably AWS; Azure or GCP acceptable).
Write efficient, well-documented code in Python and SQL to support scalable data processing.
Leverage orchestration tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, Luigi, or Step Functions) for pipeline automation.
Leverage Databricks Notebooks, Delta Lake, and Spark to build and maintain high-performance data processing workflows.
Utilize technologies such as Kafka, Spark, and Redshift for big data processing.
Perform regular code reviews and enforce best practices for data governance and security.


Data Analytics & Reporting Support


Partner with BI developers and data analysts to enable downstream reporting tools like Power BI or Tableau.
Collaborate with data scientists to provision clean, well-structured data assets.
Enable data streaming, processing, and analysis of large-scale structured and semi-structured data.


Requirements


BA/BS degree with 10 years of experience, or Master‚Äôs with 5 years of experience.
Active Public Trust Clearance or ability to obtain one.
Strong experience in Python, SQL, and AWS services (EC2, S3, RDS, Redshift, Lambda, Glue, etc.).
Hands-on experience with Databricks, including use of Notebooks, Spark clusters, Delta Lake, and integration with cloud storage.
Familiarity with Databricks SQL, MLflow, and managing jobs/workflows within the Databricks workspace is preferred.
Proficiency in working with both SQL and NoSQL databases.
Demonstrated experience in building and deploying ETL/ELT pipelines.
Working knowledge of big data tools such as Spark, Hadoop, Kafka.
Experience tuning performance in Spark-based environments, particularly within Databricks runtime environments.
Ability to work with API endpoints for data retrieval and system integration.
Strong understanding of data modeling, schema design, and performance tuning.
Experience with Agile methodologies and DevSecOps culture.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.


Preferred Experience


Prior experience supporting Department of Homeland Security (DHS), U.S. Coast Guard, or similar federal agencies.
Hands-on experience using Databricks for large-scale data processing, Delta Lake management, and collaboration across data teams.
Experience with MLOps or enabling machine learning environments using tools such as MLflow or Databricks Workflows.
Familiarity with data governance and metadata management best practices in a cloud-native environment.
Exposure to operationalizing data pipelines in mission-critical or high-security contexts.


Transferable Skills for Management Consulting


Prior experience supporting Department of Homeland Security (DHS), U.S. Coast Guard, or similar agencies.
Experience with message queues, event streaming, and high-throughput data processing.
Familiarity with BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Experience with MLOps or enabling machine learning environments.
Knowledge of data governance practices and metadata management.


JPI is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

JPI is hiring for several positions and will consider your application across our current and future openings. Expected compensation for this role is between $80,000 - $130,000, including a generous benefits package with comprehensive healthcare coverage. Please note that final compensation is dependent on a variety of factors and is reviewed regularly for both internal and external equity considerations.

Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Suffolk Construction is a national enterprise that builds, innovates, and invests, focusing on providing value throughout the entire project lifecycle. The Senior Data Analyst will design, implement, and optimize analytical solutions to drive data-informed decision-making, leading complex analyses and dashboards while ensuring data governance and quality standards are met.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Lead complex, end ‚Äë to ‚Äë end analytical projects ‚Äì frame ambiguous business questions, design robust analyses across large or multi ‚Äë source data sets, and deliver clear, actionable insights that influence strategic decisions.

‚Ä¢ Translate strategic objectives into data requirements and Agile deliverables ‚Äì partner with Product Owners to refine epics, decompose them into sprint ‚Äë ready user stories with acceptance criteria, and drive their execution (analysis, development, testing, documentation) to on ‚Äë time, high ‚Äë quality delivery.

‚Ä¢ Set standards for Business ‚Äë as ‚Äë Usual (BAU) data fulfillment ‚Äì own the BAU request pipeline, automate repetitive tasks, monitor SLAs, and coach team members to ensure consistent, scalable service levels.

‚Ä¢ Partner with Data Engineering to architect and evolve analysis ‚Äë ready data models ‚Äì collaborate to define requirements, champion best practices in ELT/ETL and data ‚Äë ops, and validate that pipelines and marts meet analytical needs for accuracy, timeliness, and cost efficiency.

‚Ä¢ Drive self ‚Äë directed deep ‚Äë dive analyses that uncover growth and efficiency opportunities ‚Äì proactively surface hypotheses, design experiments or statistical tests, and translate findings into prioritized recommendations with quantified impact.

‚Ä¢ Influence and align senior stakeholders ‚Äì craft executive ‚Äë ready narratives and visualizations, present findings to leadership, and build consensus on data ‚Äë driven initiatives, investment decisions, and KPI definitions.

‚Ä¢ Elevate team capability ‚Äì mentor analysts on analytical design, coding standards, QA, and storytelling; share best practices; and foster a culture of continuous improvement and knowledge sharing across functions.




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or related fields.

‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in data space, with a minimum of 2 years as a Data Analyst with a proven track record managing complex pipelines or systems, consistently delivering high-performance ratings, and impactful contributions to business efficiency.

‚Ä¢ Advanced proficiency in data visualization frameworks (at least one enterprise BI platform - Tableau or Power BI; with some code-first JavaScript, Python, or R).

‚Ä¢ Advanced proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data manipulation and automation.

‚Ä¢ Intermediate understanding of data engineering (e.g., ETL processes, database optimization).

‚Ä¢ Advanced statistical analysis and problem-solving.




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Advanced degree is preferred.

‚Ä¢ Experience with project ‚Äë based, asset ‚Äë heavy industries (construction, real estate development, infrastructure) is strongly preferred.

‚Ä¢ Experience in the construction subcontractor/ self-perform industry will be a strong differentiator.




Company:

Suffolk Construction is a construction contracting company. Founded in 1982, the company is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, USA, with a team of 1001-5000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. Suffolk Construction has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Nasuni is a company that delivers a unified data platform for enterprises managing unstructured data. They are seeking a motivated Data Engineer to join their Data & Analytics team, responsible for building and optimizing data infrastructure that supports reporting, analysis, and machine learning across the company.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Administer and optimize data pipelines and Snowflake platform, including warehouse sizing, query tuning, and access control policies

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain robust data transformation pipelines, leveraging data from both APIs and file-based sources

‚Ä¢ Leverage tools like dbt and Snowflake data transformations

‚Ä¢ Design, manage, and monitor data pipelines that move structured and unstructured data from multiple sources into Snowflake, ensuring reliability, performance, and cost-efficiency

‚Ä¢ Contribute to the infrastructure design and software lifecycle phases‚Äîincluding technical design, testing, implementation, and quality assurance

‚Ä¢ Provide proactive support for critical production systems, resolving pipeline or performance issues quickly and effectively

‚Ä¢ Partner with dashboard developers, analysts, and other stakeholders to support analytical, operational, and reporting needs across Nasuni

‚Ä¢ Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and demonstrate DevOps best practices




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field

‚Ä¢ 2-5 years of experience in a data engineering or data platform role with a focus on database performance and pipeline reliability

‚Ä¢ Strong SQL and Python development and optimization skills

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience administering and developing in Snowflake, including warehouse scaling, role-based access, and usage monitoring

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in building and maintaining data pipelines into Snowflake, using tools like Fivetran (or equivalent)

‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of ELT/ETL concepts and data architecture best practices across cloud and hybrid systems

‚Ä¢ Ability to work autonomously and as a team in a fast paced environment

‚Ä¢ High level of attention to detail with the ability to multi-task effectively

‚Ä¢ High degree of professionalism and ability to maintain confidential information

‚Ä¢ Excellent organizational and time management skills

‚Ä¢ Aptitude and ability to apply academic or applied experience in software development or data engineering related field

‚Ä¢ An advanced understanding of modern ELT practices, database development, SQL and query optimizations, stored procedures, views, and other db objects

‚Ä¢ Able to design data solutions to allow for cost-effective, scalable, fast, and flexible solutions to support front-end development, analyst work, and data health and monitoring needs

‚Ä¢ Able to pick up quickly and think both creatively and critically to solve problems

‚Ä¢ A team-player that collaborates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders




Company:

Nasuni is a cloud storage company that provides hybrid cloud-based storage and file-sharing platforms to manage file growth. Founded in 2009, the company is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, USA, with a team of 501-1000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. Nasuni has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Director of Data Analytics
Description:
We‚Äôre partnering with a mission-driven organization that empowers families navigating the aging journey‚Äîoffering a unique combination of compassion, innovation, and data-driven strategy to make a meaningful impact on millions of lives.




Location: Remote (Eastern or Central Time Zone preferred)

Title: Director, Data Analysis




We‚Äôre seeking a Director of Data Analysis to lead a high-performing analytics team within the U.S. Life Insurance division. This person will design and optimize business intelligence strategies, enabling senior leaders to make informed, data-driven decisions that enhance customer experience and operational efficiency.




This is a high-impact, highly visible role reporting directly to the Senior Director of Data Strategy. Ideal candidates will bring a strong analytical background, technical depth, and proven leadership in building data-centric cultures.




What You‚Äôll Do




Lead a team of analysts, fostering a collaborative, insight-driven environment
Partner with business leaders to develop analytical solutions that drive strategic goals
Build dashboards, reports, and models that influence executive decision-making
Advance self-service BI tools and automated reporting capabilities
Communicate clearly and persuasively with stakeholders at all levels
Oversee key performance tracking, controls, and process improvement initiatives




What You Bring




10+ years of analytics experience with 5+ years in leadership roles
Strong background in data strategy, visualization (e.g., Tableau, Power BI), and analytics tools (Python, R, SQL)
Experience with cloud data tech (AWS, Azure) and RDBMS platforms
Excellent communication skills and ability to influence cross-functionally
Bachelor‚Äôs in Math, Stats, Econ, CS, or related field (Master‚Äôs/PhD a plus)
Insurance industry experience is a bonus, but not required




Culture & Benefits




Competitive comp + performance incentives
401(k) with employer contributions
Fully employer-funded retirement plan
Comprehensive health coverage + wellness programs
Generous PTO, family leave, and volunteer time off
Tuition reimbursement and professional development
Mental health & caregiver support




Interested in learning more?




This is a confidential search led by Tom Cox. If you're a data leader who‚Äôs passionate about driving meaningful outcomes through analytics‚Äîand looking to make an impact with a purpose-driven organization‚Äîwe‚Äôd love to connect.

Title: Data Engineer II
Description:
Premise Health is Different on Purpose

Premise Health serves large organizations and their people with exceptional healthcare. The result? Better experiences, better health, and better value, all while helping organizations lower their healthcare costs.

Premise's mission is to help people get, stay, and be well. Come join us and see for yourself why amazing health starts with amazing healthcare. For more information, visit www.jobs.premisehealth.com.

The Data Engineer II will be responsible for building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines, managing our azure delta lake architecture, and supporting analytics initiatives across the organization. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Azure Databricks, data engineering, and develops pipeline. The successful candidate will work closely with our platform architects and data science teams to ensure seamless integration of data pipelines and Lakehouse architecture. This role should ensure coding standard and coding migration to higher environment and CI/CD.

This is a Full Time, Remote Data Engineer II role.

What You'll Do


Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines using Azure Databricks, Apache Spark, and Python.
Collaborate with data engineering teams to integrate data from EPIC, Clarity, and Caboodle and other on-premise source systems to Azure.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security throughout the data pipeline.
Automate unit test cases as part of Data Pipeline.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of our Lakehouse architecture using Azure Databricks and Delta Lake.
Ensure data governance and security in the Lakehouse environment
Should be able to execute POCs to evaluate new tool, concepts introduced by Azure/ Databricks.
Troubleshoot data pipeline and Lakehouse architecture issues, identifying and resolving bottlenecks and errors.
Optimize data pipeline and Lakehouse architecture performance, scalability, cost and reliability.
Collaborate with data science teams to integrate data pipelines and Lakehouse architecture with data science workflows.
Ensure seamless data exchange between data engineering and data science teams.
Participate in peer review for coding standards.
Subject matter expert for pySpark and Scala.
Other duties as assigned.


What You'll Bring


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Cisco CCNP, Microsoft Azure Solutions Architect, or ITIL preferred.
Databricks and Azure certification preferred.
5+ years of experience in Cloud development practice.
Strong expertise in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), virtualization, and networking.
Preferred experience with infrastructure automation tools (Terraform, Ansible, Kubernetes).
Proficiency in Linux and Windows server administration.
Solid knowledge of cybersecurity best practices and disaster recovery planning.
Strong leadership experience in managing technical teams and project management skills.
Knowledge of log management and monitoring tools (Splunk, Datadog, Prometheus).
Knowledge on Talend, Power BI and Qlik
Familiarity with containerization and microservices


Work-life balance is at the foundation of how decisions are made and where Premise is headed. We can only help people get, stay, and be well if we do the same for ourselves. In addition to competitive pay, Premise offers full-time team members benefits including medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, a 401(k) program with company match, paid holidays and vacation time, a company-sponsored wellness program, EAP, access to virtual primary care and virtual behavioral health at no cost for team members and their dependents. Additional benefits can be viewed here: https://jobs.premisehealth.com/benefits.

Premise is an equal opportunity employer; we value inclusion and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex (including pregnancy and related conditions), gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.

Premise provides its reasonable and genuinely expected range of compensation for this job of $105,000.00 - $120,000.00 annually. A number of factors will influence the rate offered for this position, including your experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other factors.

For individuals living in Washington or Colorado: Premise offers the following paid time off benefits. Employees will earn 0.0692 hours of paid time off per actual hours worked or based on standard schedule, per pay period, and will receive 10 paid holidays or an equivalent bank of hours aligned to schedule throughout the calendar year. Paid sick leave is satisfied by the paid time off accrual, detailed above.

This posting is anticipated to close within 10 days of 08/04/2025.

Should you have questions regarding this job posting, please contact askhr@premisehealth.com.

Title: System Administrator
Description:
Company Description

Customized Energy Solutions (CES), a privately-held company, is a leading service provider of market intelligence and operational support services to companies participating in the retail and wholesale electric and natural gas markets. Utilizing deep know-how developed since the inception of the deregulated energy markets, CES provides accurate & timely analysis on regulatory changes, market opportunities, and operational efficiencies for electricity and natural gas commodities. CES is also a third-party asset manager of more than 13,000 MWs of renewable and conventional generation resources across all ISOs in the United States, Ontario, Canada and Guam. CES empowers clients to achieve their goals by helping them navigate the evolving energy markets, complex market rules, and new energy technologies.

Join a rapidly growing company in an exciting and dynamic work environment. As one of the top 100 fastest growing companies in the Philadelphia region, Customized Energy Solutions offers an opportunity for significant professional growth.

Customized Energy Solutions Ltd. has been recognized regionally and nationally for its impressive and sustained growth, including INC. 500 | 5000 and The Philadelphia Business Journal as a Top 100 Companies in Philadelphia, Hall of Fame for five or more consecutive years. It was ranked as one of the ‚ÄúBest Places to Work‚Äù by the Philadelphia Business Journal.

Our team of associates at CES is highly motivated, innovative, and passionate about providing excellent Services to our clients. We look for individuals interested in growing with our company, and working in an exciting, open and collegial work environment. Our main office is in Philadelphia, with satellite offices in various U.S. states, Canada, Japan, India and Vietnam.

Job Description

The Systems Administrator will play an important role in overseeing various technical administrative responsibilities within the organization. This position will be primarily responsible for maintaining a variety of industry leading network monitoring and management tools and utilities. The individual filling this role will interact and coordinate with internal client teams to enable improved awareness and visibility into the status and performance of network, server, and cloud infrastructure. Additionally, this role will be responsible for managing hands-on network and infrastructure support tasks in the Philadelphia metro area. The Systems and Network Administrator will address technical needs and maintain vigilance over system availability. The candidate filling this role will function as an escalation path for support of technology-related issues and will support the Infrastructure Services team including rotating on-call schedule. This is an on-site position.

Job Responsibilities


Configure, manage, and maintain enterprise network management, monitoring, and auditing tools to ensure optimal system performance, availability, and alerting.
Oversee the implementation and ongoing management of enterprise password and secrets management tool.
Develop and customize dashboards, alerts, and reports for effective monitoring and reporting of enterprise systems.
Ensure accurate logging and auditing of network activities in accordance with organizational policies.
Integrate Service Desk Application with automation and monitoring tools to streamline workflows and automate processes.
Support and manage the Security Suite for incident response, vulnerability scanning, and security operations center (SOC) integration.
Deploy and manage the enterprise vulnerability management and patching platform for hosted vulnerability and patch management across various systems.
Administer Microsoft SCCM, InTune, and AutoPilot for build automation, mobile device management (MDM), and device provisioning.


Qualifications


Minimum of 5 years‚Äô experience in IT infrastructure, monitoring systems administration, or related roles.
Hands-on experience with and relevant certifications in the listed tools, especially SolarWinds Orion, Delinea Secret Server, Rapid7, Automox, Microsoft Modern Desktop Administrator, SCCM, Intune, AutoPilot, or comparable industry accepted solutions.
Proven ability to develop integrations and automation between various IT tools.
Knowledge of scripting and automation (e.g., PowerShell, Python) to enhance system integrations.
Strong understanding of network monitoring, auditing, security operations, and ITSM processes.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Ability to understand and follow documentation, repeat existing processes and create new documentation.
Ability to work effectively in a team and individually with minimal supervision.


Additional Information

At Customized Energy Solutions, we offer a competitive salary based on experience, along with comprehensive benefits like performance-based bonuses, comprehensive health coverage, and tuition reimbursement to support your ongoing growth and success

Customized Energy Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Additionally, this role will be responsible for managing hands-on network and infrastructure support tasks in the Philadelphia metro area. The Systems and Network Administrator will address technical needs and maintain vigilance over system availability. The candidate filling this role will function as an escalation path for support of technology-related issues and will support the Infrastructure Services team including rotating on-call schedule. This is an on-site position.

Job Responsibilities

  • Configure, manage, and maintain enterprise network management, monitoring, and auditing tools to ensure optimal system performance, availability, and alerting.
  • Oversee the implementation and ongoing management of enterprise password and secrets management tool.
  • Develop and customize dashboards, alerts, and reports for effective monitoring and reporting of enterprise systems.
  • Ensure accurate logging and auditing of network activities in accordance with organizational policies.
  • Integrate Service Desk Application with automation and monitoring tools to streamline workflows and automate processes.
  • Support and manage the Security Suite for incident response, vulnerability scanning, and security operations center (SOC) integration.
  • Deploy and manage the enterprise vulnerability management and patching platform for hosted vulnerability and patch management across various systems.
  • Administer Microsoft SCCM, InTune, and AutoPilot for build automation, mobile device management (MDM), and device provisioning.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 5 years‚Äô experience in IT infrastructure, monitoring systems administration, or related roles.
  • Hands-on experience with and relevant certifications in the listed tools, especially SolarWinds Orion, Delinea Secret Server, Rapid7, Automox, Microsoft Modern Desktop Administrator, SCCM, Intune, AutoPilot, or comparable industry accepted solutions.
  • Proven ability to develop integrations and automation between various IT tools.
  • Knowledge of scripting and automation (e.g., PowerShell, Python) to enhance system integrations.
  • Strong understanding of network monitoring, auditing, security operations, and ITSM processes.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
  • Ability to understand and follow documentation, repeat existing processes and create new documentation.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team and individually with minimal supervision.

Additional Information

At Customized Energy Solutions, we offer a competitive salary based on experience, along with comprehensive benefits like performance-based bonuses, comprehensive health coverage, and tuition reimbursement to support your ongoing growth and success

Customized Energy Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Information Technology Coordinator (Grade 12)
Description:
Nature of Work

THE CITY OF HUNTSVILLE'S INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY SERVICES DEPARTMENT WANTS YOU!

The City of Huntsville's I.T.S. department is seeking qualified applicants to fill our

Information Technology Coordinator position.

Exciting Opportunities for Smart and Talented People.

Come join our growing I.T.S. Team! Apply today!

About Our Department

The Information Technology Service Department's primary responsibilities are in the areas of providing information technology, developing and implementing recommended standards for information technology, developing and maintaining security policies and systems and coordinating the acquisition of information technology for all City Departments. Our goal is to provide the best data processing services to the City through the effective utilization of existing and new information technology. The ITS Department will implement and support technologies and processes that will increase service to City employees and enhance staff productivity.

Information Technology Coordinator Position Overview

This is administrative and technical work involving coordination of inventory and installation of computer hardware and software or telephone communications equipment including radios, data lines, and pagers and providing support to users. Work involves managing and maintaining computer hardware and software or telephone communications equipment inventory. Coordinates installation of equipment and software. Assists users with computer and telephone equipment and software operation. Work is performed with some independence for initiative, judgment and action, and is reviewed for adherence to policies and procedures, accuracy and completeness and for results achieved.

Qualifications And Necessary Special Requirements

High school diploma from a school accredited by a regional accrediting agency recognized by the U.S. Department of Education or GED certificate issued by the appropriate state agency, supplemented by college level courses in computer science or a related field and experience in the field of information or communication technology; or any combination of education, training and experience.

Valid Driver's License

Must submit to fingerprinting background check

For More Information Regarding the Information Technology Coordinator Job Duties, Please Visit the Websites Below:

https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/huntsville/classspecs/81985

Title: Remote Data Entry Clerk
Description:
Employer Industry: Remote Work and Research Studies

Why Consider This Job Opportunity


Flexible work schedule, allowing you to work part-time or full-time from anywhere
Comprehensive training provided to ensure your success in the role
Opportunity to participate in meaningful research studies that contribute to valuable outcomes
Ideal for individuals seeking to supplement existing jobs or transition to remote work
No degree required, welcoming candidates from various backgrounds
Perfect for stay-at-home parents, retirees, and anyone looking to earn an income online


What To Expect (Job Responsibilities)


Participate in research studies that contribute to meaningful outcomes
Work remotely in a flexible environment that accommodates your schedule
Read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions
Utilize your computer and internet access to complete tasks
Maintain a quiet workspace free from distractions


What Is Required (Qualifications)


Must have a computer with internet access
Comfortable working in an environment without immediate supervision
Ability to read, understand, and follow instructions
Data entry skills with a minimum typing speed of 25 words per minute
Background in healthcare, customer service, or other relevant fields is welcomed


How To Stand Out (Preferred Qualifications)


Previous experience as a data entry clerk or administrative assistant is a bonus
Familiarity with using a laptop and conducting studies via webcam or smartphone
Willingness to learn and adapt to new tasks and technologies


#RemoteWork #FlexibleSchedule #ResearchStudies #NoDegreeRequired #IncomeOpportunities

We prioritize candidate privacy and champion equal-opportunity employment. Central to our mission is our partnership with companies that share this commitment. We aim to foster a fair, transparent, and secure hiring environment for all. If you encounter any employer not adhering to these principles, please bring it to our attention immediately.

We are not the EOR (Employer of Record) for this position. Our role in this specific opportunity is to connect outstanding candidates with a top-tier employer.

Talentify helps candidates around the world to discover and stay focused on the jobs they want until they can complete a full application in the hiring company career page/ATS.

Title: Technical Support Specialist
Description:
Description

Technical Support Specialist

Sangoma, a leader in business communications solutions, is seeking a dedicated Technical Support Specialist to join our team. With a reputation built on reliability and innovation, we provide fully integrated UCaaS solutions encompassing telephony, meetings, messaging, and more. As part of our commitment to superior customer service, this role plays a crucial part in assisting our partners and customers and ensuring seamless operations across our platforms. You will be at the forefront of technical support, troubleshooting issues, and contributing to the overall enhancement of our services. If you have a passion for telecommunications and a strong technical background, we invite you to help us deliver the best solutions for our clients. We are looking for talented technical support staff to join our team. Must submit your resume in English.

Your Role


Assisting company employees with technical requests
Triaging, prioritizing and routing all issues that come into the system
Ensuring that end users are being kept up to date on their ticket status
Managing user experience items on the corporate PBX systems like desk phones and voicemail
Ensuring that shared printer/copier/scanners are maintained and online across the company
Maintaining software license documentation for the organization
Proactive management of end user laptops, desktops and mobile devices
Basic network troubleshooting, including remote connectivity issues for end users
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with end user laptops, desktops and mobile devices
Ensuring the end user devices meet security standards as laid out in corporate policy
Some systems administration oriented work
Sharing after-hours triage responsibilities with the IT team
Other duties as assigned by management


Requirements

Your Background:


Willingness to jump into unfamiliar situations, ask questions and learn
A warm, customer-service oriented, disposition
Willingness to ‚Äúown‚Äù a problem from initial report until final resolution
Must demonstrate a high proficiency in technical troubleshooting
Installing/configuring software and hardware on laptops, desktops and mobile devices
Managing inventory of company laptops, desktops and mobile devices
Familiarity with common end-user applications including: Chrome/Firefox, gSuite, MS Office suite, etc
Above average verbal and written communication skills
Fluent in English
2 year certificate or degree from an accredited institution


Preferred Experience


Experience using Atlassian‚Äôs Jira platform for ticket management
Experience managing a VoIP PBX phone system
Experience with working on an IT team or on in a helpdesk type situation
Hands-on experience working with gSuite, Active Directory and anti-virus|malware platforms.
4 year degree from an accredited institution
Must have expert level written and verbal English vocational skills.


Benefits

What We Offer:


Extensive Benefit Options are effective after a short waiting period
Flexible Time Off & Company Holidays
Entrepreneurial work environment partnered with high-growth career opportunities


Apply for this job

Title: Chief Executive Officer
Description:
THE PORTFOLIO COMPANY

This PE-backed platform delivers inspection, maintenance, and installation services across fire and life safety systems, with a primary focus on the marine sector‚Äîserving commercial vessels, private yachts, cruise lines, and military ships. With operations in Oakland, Fort Lauderdale, and Los Angeles, the business is actively transitioning from marine dominance to expanding into commercial and industrial real estate fire safety services. The company has completed three acquisitions since September 2024, with ambitions to build a national platform through both M&A and organic growth.

The platform currently generates $20M in revenue with $3.3M in YTD EBITDA and a goal to reach $5M EBITDA by year-end. The long-term vision is to scale to $15‚Äì$20M EBITDA and achieve a strategic or sponsor-backed exit.




THE PRIVATE EQUITY FIRM

The firm is a first-time fund with $100M AUM, pursuing control buyouts and aggressive buy-and-build strategies across Industrials, Business Services, and Healthcare. Their investment thesis centers on professionalizing founder-led businesses and scaling platforms through focused M&A and operational improvement. The firm is hands-on early in the hold and highly supportive in execution. They invest in people, not just assets.

Other portfolio businesses include HVAC services and fire safety platforms. The team is based in Los Angeles and is deeply involved in strategy and execution‚Äîstepping in when needed and stepping back once teams are built.




THE CULTURE

The platform is in the early stages of cultural transformation. Historically founder-led and location-centric, the business is moving from a fractured C-grade culture toward a cohesive, mission-driven environment. Pride exists at the field level, particularly in marine services, but there is a strong need for leadership to instill structure, values, and accountability.

The CEO will be instrumental in driving this cultural shift‚Äîdeveloping leadership, building an outbound sales motion, professionalizing service delivery, and establishing core business functions such as HR and strategic operations.




VISION

What does success look like in this role?

Reach $5M EBITDA by year-end and $15‚Äì$20M within 3 years.
Execute a quarterly cadence of acquisitions with seamless integration.
Build and lead a high-performance team‚ÄîVP Sales, Ops Lead, VP M&A, HR Lead.
Drive cultural transformation across three locations.
Migrate from marine-dominant to diversified fire & life safety platform.
Position the company for a strategic or sponsor-led exit.




THE ROLE

The CEO will be responsible for:

Leading all aspects of the platform‚Äîstrategy, operations, financial performance, and culture.
Building and leading a team capable of scaling to $20M EBITDA.
Executing and integrating add-on acquisitions in coordination with Walk-On Capital.
Driving organic growth initiatives including outbound sales and commercial expansion.
Professionalizing all business functions: HR, service delivery, finance, and operations.
Representing the platform to the board and investors.




KEY SELLING POINTS OF THE ROLE

Lead a growing platform in a $68.5Bn+ market with strong M&A momentum.
Opportunity to build and own the story of a sponsor-backed roll-up.
High equity upside‚Äîaligned directly with the sponsor's contribution.
Supportive and execution-driven board with track record of value creation.
Be the face of a future $20M EBITDA exit with strategic and sponsor interest already validated.




KEY CHALLENGES FOR THE ROLE

First-time PE-backed business‚Äîrequires pace, structure, and vision.
Fragmented operations and inconsistent professionalism across sites.
Low process maturity‚Äîrequires hands-on transformation.
Marine sector complexity requires sensitivity to safety, regulation, and nuance.
Building trust and alignment across legacy leadership and new team.




YOUR BACKGROUND

Successful candidates will demonstrate:

Prior CEO or #2 experience in a PE-backed business.
Buy-and-build experience‚Äîdeal sourcing, diligence, and integration.
Industry experience in Fire & Life Safety, Facilities Services, or related sectors.
Proven leadership across both blue- and white-collar environments.
Track record of building high-performing teams and scaling to $10M+ EBITDA.




YOUR CHARACTERISTICS

Strategic and structured thinker with execution bias.
High ownership mindset‚Äîproactive and solutions-driven.
Servant leader with strong team-building ability.
Comfortable rolling up sleeves‚Äîlead from the front.
High emotional intelligence with disciplined leadership.




LOCATION

Flexible ‚Äì must be willing to travel weekly




COMPENSATION PACKAGE

Basic Salary: $325,000‚Äì$400,000
Bonus: 25‚Äì35%
Equity: Up to 5% of the Management Incentive Plan (MIP), fully aligned with sponsor‚Äôs contribution
Benefits: 401k, healthcare




Raw Selection is an executive search firm working exclusively with Private Equity firms and their portfolio companies across Europe & North America.




Are you subscribed to the Private Equity Podcast?

https://www.raw-selection.com/the-private-equity-podcast/

Are you subscribed to the Private Equity YouTube channel?

https://www.youtube.com/@RawSelection

Are you part of our communities?

https://www.raw-selection.com/communities/

Title: Business Analyst, Associate II
Description:
Who We Are Looking For

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a growing team, and the incumbent will contribute to key strategic projects in addition to delivering services for our clients. This Associate position plays a key role within our mutual fund trading team. The role will be responsible for onboarding new key clients to our unit dealing service and will contribute to testing our new mutual fund trading platform and will contribute to building our future state model.

Why this role is important to us

The team you will be joining plays an important role in the overall success of the organization. Across the globe, institutional investors rely on us to help them manage risk, respond to challenges, and drive performance and profitability. To make that happen we need teams like yours to help navigate employees and the organization as a whole. In your role you will strive for cutting-edge solutions, that are straightforward and scalable. You will help us build resilience and execute day to day deliverables at our best.

Join us if making your mark in the financial services industry from day one is a challenge you are up for.

What You Will Be Responsible For

As Unit Dealing Associate II you will


Develop a deep understanding of existing mutual fund trading infrastructure and business processes
Assist with client conversions/start-ups of new client relationships
Work autonomously with confidence in a fast-moving, complex technical environment
Build relationships with colleagues across multiple functional groups
Assist with business requirements, testing, and implementing new functionality on our trading application in coordination with management team, clients, IT, and the vendor
Research and resolve inquiries for clients, trading partners, and internal stakeholders
Ensure all team deliverables are met within assigned deadlines on a daily basis, document and update procedures and team checklists, ensure adherence to standard operating procedures
Assist with client reporting and client projects
Analyze internal processes and look to automate, reduce risk, and streamline workflows



What We Value

These skills will help you succeed in this role


Analytical mindset and strong critical thinking
Problem solving and decision making skills
Confident & clear communicator with ability to articulate complex concepts to any audience
Highly motivated with exceptional integrity
Ability to understand and contribute to documented business and technical system requirements



Education & Preferred Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent
3+ years‚Äô experience in financial services industry



About State Street

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation we‚Äôre making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we‚Äôve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.

Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary in locations, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans among other perks. You‚Äôll have access to flexible Work Program to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.

Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees‚Äô diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspective are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome the candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift program and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.

State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Discover more at StateStreet.com/careers

Salary Range

$41,600 - $66,560 Annual

The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

Job Application Disclosure

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

  • Analytical mindset and strong critical thinking
  • Problem solving and decision making skills
  • Confident & clear communicator with ability to articulate complex concepts to any audience
  • Highly motivated with exceptional integrity
  • Ability to understand and contribute to documented business and technical system requirements


Education & Preferred Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent
  • 3+ years‚Äô experience in financial services industry


About State Street

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation we‚Äôre making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we‚Äôve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.

Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary in locations, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans among other perks. You‚Äôll have access to flexible Work Program to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.

Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees‚Äô diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspective are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome the candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift program and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.

State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Discover more at StateStreet.com/careers

Salary Range

$41,600 - $66,560 Annual

The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

Job Application Disclosure

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

Job ID: R-775411

Title: Health Plan Request Bench Release of Information Specialist II
Description:
Summary Of Position

The Health Plan Request (HPR) Bench Release of Information Specialist (ROIS) II processes release of information (ROI) requests related to health plan audits with accuracy, efficiency, and compliance across multiple client accounts. This role requires a high level of proficiency in various electronic medical record (EMR) systems, adherence to HIPAA regulations and uphold strict confidentiality standards. The HPR Bench ROIS III independently prioritizes tasks, troubleshoots requests, and collaborates effectively with internal teams while adapting to evolving workflows and compliance requirements, as well as ensuring they can fulfill all client-specific onboarding and access requirements.

Duties & Responsibilities


Process medical ROI requests related to health plan audits quickly and accurately, ensuring compliance with HIPAA and client requirements
Utilize Verisma software applications to input, manage, and track medical records
Organize and retrieve records within multiple EMR systems, ensuring all documentation is properly structured and complete
Interpret medical records, forms, and authorizations to correspond to specific audit measures
Maintain high standards of production, efficiency, and accuracy meeting company standards and performance metrics
Prioritize workload effectively and work independently while meeting productivity goals
Communicate effectively within the HPR team and in a cross-functional manner, as necessary
Attain a solid understanding of client-specific expectations across multiple accounts while ensuring compliance with HIPAA, HITECH, state regulations, and company policies
Utilize Verisma‚Äôs reference materials and compliance guidelines to maintain confidentiality and accuracy in all tasks
Assist with training and mentoring new associates, as needed, ensuring knowledge transfer and consistency in processes
Attend and actively participate in training sessions, workflow updates and team meetings, as required
Maintain all necessary background checks, drug screenings, health screenings and access requirements to serve on the Bench
Perform other related duties, as assigned, to support the effective operation of the department and the company
Live by and promote Verisma Core Values


Minimum Qualifications


High school diploma or equivalent required; some college preferred
RHIT certification preferred
3+ years of experience in medical records, Release of Information (ROI), or Health Information Management (HIM), with expertise in supporting multiple clients and processing audit requests
Knowledge of HIPAA and state regulations related to the release of protected health information
Must be able to maintain all necessary background checks, drug screenings, health screenings and access requirements to serve on the Bench
Clerical or office experience with data entry, document management and proficiency in using general office equipment
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and multiple EMR systems, with the ability to troubleshoot and adapt to new technologies
Strong problem-solving, organizational and time management skills with keen attention to detail
Strong ability to work independently while meeting high productivity expectations
Ability to effectively multi-task or change projects, as needed
Prior remote experience, preferred


Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without prior notice.

Title: Remote Release of Information Specialist I
Description:
Release of Information Specialist I (ROIS I)

Summary Of Position

The Release of Information Specialist I (ROIS I) initiates the medical record release process by inputting data into Verisma Software. The ROIS I works quickly and carefully to ensure documentation is processed accurately and efficiently. This position could be based out of a Verisma facility, at a client site, or in some instances may be done remotely. The primary supervisor is Manager of Operations, Release of Information.

Duties & Responsibilities


Process medical ROI requests in a timely and efficient manner
Process requests utilizing Verisma software applications
Support the resolution of HIPAA-related release issues
Organize records and documents to complete the ROI process
Read and interpret medical records, forms, and authorizations
Provide exemplary customer service in person, on the phone and via email, depending on location requirements
Interact with customers and co-workers in a professional and friendly manner
Utilize reference material provided by Verisma to ensure compliance and confidentiality is always maintained
Attend training sessions, as required
Live by and promote Verisma company values
Perform other related duties, as assigned, to ensure effective operation of the department and the Company


Minimum Qualifications


HS Diploma or equivalent, some college preferred
RHIT certification, preferred
2+ years of medical record experience
2+ years of experience completing clerical or office work
Experience using general office equipment including desktop computer, scanner, Microsoft Office Suite to complete tasks
Experience in a healthcare setting, preferred
Knowledge of HIPAA and state regulations related to the release of Protected Health Information, preferred
Must be able to work independently
Must be detail oriented


Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
