Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

We are looking for a highly motivated Data Analyst to join our growing team in the UK. In this role, you will work closely with our Product and Operations teams to monitor key metrics, build operational dashboards, conduct product analysis, and provide actionable insights to drive decision-making.




You‚Äôll play a key role in transforming raw data into clear narratives that support business growth and improve user experiences. Strong communication skills are essential, as you will be expected to work closely with stakeholders across various functions and explain findings to non-technical audiences.




Key Responsibilities:

Apply expertise in data analysis to see beyond the numbers and understand user behaviour.
Proactively identify trends, anomalies, and growth opportunities through data analysis.
Build and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor business operations and KPIs.
Collaborate cross-functionally with product managers, operations teams, and other stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver data solutions.
Translate complex data into meaningful, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Support ad hoc data needs from stakeholders.
Continuously assess emerging technologies and architectural patterns to drive innovation and platform competitiveness.
Create technical specifications, architectural diagrams, and decision records to support long-term sustainability.




Qualifications & Skills:

3+ years of experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role.
Proficient in SQL, Python (especially for data analysis), and Tableau (or other BI tools).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
Experience working closely with Product and/or Operations teams.
Ability to clearly communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders with diverse backgrounds.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Mandarin proficiency is preferred.




Good To Have:

Experience with quantitative analysis, including A/B testing, funnel analysis, or cohort tracking.
Solid foundation in statistics and data interpretation.
Experience working on mobile app or web product analytics.
Familiarity with modern big data frameworks (e.g., Spark, Hive, Presto) is a plus.




We Offer:

Experience a dynamic and team-orientated work environment.
Opportunities for personal growth and learning.
An open, inclusive and supportive team where you will be valued, and your suggestions will be welcome.
26 days paid holiday per year, in addition to local public holidays
Competitive salary
Risk Benefits such as pension, Life Assurance (4x annual salary),
Private Medical InsuranceTeam Building activities
Local discounts and more...!

Title: Data Insight Analyst
Description:
Successful candidates may be based in any of our office locations ‚Äì Cardiff, Glasgow, or London. We especially welcome applicants from Cardiff and Glasgow.

Job Summary

Effective use of data is at the centre of our work to bring about a Net Zero energy supply. Ofgem is Great Britain‚Äôs independent energy regulator. We‚Äôre at the forefront of change across the energy sector, driving toward Net Zero whilst protecting energy consumers, especially vulnerable people. ‚ÄØ

As a Data Insight Analyst, you‚Äôll be joining our dynamic and high performing Analytics team. This fast-paced, cross-functional group is at the forefront of delivering impactful insights across Ofgem. With a diverse and knowledgeable makeup, the team plays a key role in accelerating data-driven decision-making, leveraging emerging technologies to drive digital transformation, and enabling self-service analytics.

In this role, you‚Äôll design, build, test and deploy new analytic products, while also maintaining existing ones. You‚Äôll be responsible for developing dashboards, reports, visualisations and alerts that support strategic decision-making using technologies such as Power BI, Azure Synapse, SQL and Python.

You‚Äôll work with a variety of data sources and pipelines to deliver meaningful analysis, uncovering trends, enabling drilldowns and generating forecasts. Your expertise will also contribute to training sessions, where you‚Äôll share techniques and best practices with others.

With a solid foundation in statistics, you‚Äôll bring a keen interest in how data, analytics and visualisation can influence decisions. Ideally, you‚Äôll have certified experience with visualisation tools and be confident in communicating and presenting your findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.

You‚Äôll be adept at managing and prioritising multiple projects and stakeholders, preferably with experience in data modelling, SQL for data transformation, and data science tools such as Python.

In this role, you will be part of our DDaT Profession, where you will be supported across the profession with personal and professional learning and development opportunities. This is a great role to start your career within data with lots of room for progression.‚ÄØ

Job Description

This Role:

The Data Insights Analyst role sits in the Analytics team within Data & AI function and plays a key role accelerating data driven decision making, digital transformation and enable self-service analytics across Ofgem. They will aid in the design and development of analytic products such as dashboards, reports, visualisations and alerts to answer strategic business questions using a range of modern data analytics technology e.g. Power Bi, Azure Synapse and Python.

The individual in this role will adhere to internal D&AI team best practices and standards, highlighting to the community where improvements could be made and participating in peer reviews. They will support their colleagues to promote and champion good data practice throughout Ofgem e.g. data collection standards, data visualisation, data management and operations.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with business users to design analytics products and embed insights into decision making processes.
Design, build and test data products such as Power BI dashboards, semantic models and database views.
Collaborate with the Data Engineering and Operations team to triage, troubleshoot and resolve support issues with products.
Identify and present opportunities for improvements and enhancements to process and product.
Contribute to expanding Ofgem's analytics and AI capabilities through research and innovation.


Key Outputs and Deliverables


Development of data products and supporting documentation.
Lead or contribute to resolving issues in data products to ensure reliability and performance.
Support the development of data collection templates, data pipelines and automation routines.
Support the validation of user requirements and their technical design.
Create engaging materials to promote data product adoption across Ofgem, participate in show & tells, workshops and roadshows.


Key Responsibilities


Partner with business users to design analytics products and embed insights into decision making processes.
Design, build and test data products such as Power BI dashboards, semantic models and database views.
Collaborate with the Data Engineering and Operations team to triage, troubleshoot and resolve support issues with products.
Identify and present opportunities for improvements and enhancements to process and product.
Contribute to expanding Ofgem's analytics and AI capabilities through research and innovation.


Key Outputs and Deliverables


Development of data products and supporting documentation.
Lead or contribute to resolving issues in data products to ensure reliability and performance.
Support the development of data collection templates, data pipelines and automation routines.
Support the validation of user requirements and their technical design.
Create engaging materials to promote data product adoption across Ofgem, participate in show & tells, workshops and roadshows.


Person specification

Essential Criteria


Extensive experience of using data visualisation software such as Power BI to develop reports and dashboards. (Lead criteria)
Experience working with complex data models (ideally in Azure Synapse), writing SQL to manipulate and transform data, in order to create semantic models optimised for Power BI consumption.
Good communication skills, ability to explain technical concepts and confident in presenting insights to both technical and non-technical users.


Desirable Criteria


Experience working in an agile team with ability to manage multiple work items and prioritise effectively.
Certification in Power BI.


Behaviours

We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:


Changing and Improving
Making Effective Decisions
Working Together


Technical skills

We'll assess you against these technical skills during the selection process:


At interview, you will be presented with a technical scenario to work through and discuss with the panel. Follow-up questions will be included. No prior preparation is required.


Alongside your salary of ¬£34,123, OFGEM contributes ¬£9,885 towards you being a member of the Civil Service Defined Benefit Pension scheme. Find out what benefits a Civil Service Pension provides.

Ofgem can offer you a comprehensive and competitive benefits package which includes; 30 days annual leave after 2 years; Excellent training and development opportunities; The opportunity to join the generous Civil Service pension which also includes a valuable range of benefits; hybrid working (currently 1 day a week in the office but this is kept under review), flexible working hours and family friendly policies. Plus lots of other benefits including clean and bright offices based centrally, engaged networks and teams and an opportunity to contribute to our ambitious and important targets of establishing a Net Zero energy system by 2050. This exciting blend of professional challenge and personal reward identifies career opportunities at Ofgem as something to get excited about.

Selection process details

This vacancy is using Success Profiles (opens in a new window), and will assess your Behaviours, Ability, Experience and Technical skills.

When you press the ‚ÄòApply now‚Äô button, you will be directed to two Civil Service tests ‚Äì guidance for these can be found here Civil Service online tests - GOV.UK (www.gov.uk). Upon passing the tests, you will be asked to complete the full application, which includes uploading a copy of your anonymised CV and your 1250-word personal statement.

The 1250 word ‚Äòpersonal statement' should evidence how you meet the essential and desirable skills listed in the role profile. Please ensure you demonstrate clearly, within your supporting statement, how you meet each of the essential and desirable skills and capabilities.

The Civil Service values honesty and integrity and expects all candidates to abide by these principles. You must ensure that any evidence submitted as part of your application or used during interview, including your CV and any statements or examples, are truthful and factually accurate. Ofgem takes any incidences of cheating very seriously. Please ensure all examples provided are of your own experience. Any instances of plagiarism or other forms of cheating will be investigated and, if proven, the relevant applications will be withdrawn from the process. Please note that plagiarism can include presenting the ideas and experiences of others, or generated by artificial intelligence, as your own.

Please refer to Civil Service candidate advice on the acceptable use of artificial intelligence within the recruitment and selection process - Artificial intelligence and recruitment , Civil Service Careers

The personal information we have collected from you will be shared with Cifas who will use it to prevent fraud, other unlawful or dishonest conduct, malpractice, and other seriously improper conduct. If any of these are detected, you could be refused certain services or employment. Your personal information will also be used to verify your identity. Further details of how your information will be used by us and Cifas, and your data protection rights, can be found by [https://www.cifas.org.uk/fpn].

Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.

This vacancy is using Success Profiles (opens in a new window), and will assess your Behaviours, Ability, Experience and Technical skills.

Security

Successful candidates must undergo a criminal record check.

People working with government assets must complete baseline personnel security standard (opens in new window) checks.

Successful candidates must undergo a criminal record check.

People working with government assets must complete baseline personnel security standard (opens in new window) checks.

Nationality requirements

This Job Is Broadly Open To The Following Groups:


UK nationals
nationals of the Republic of Ireland
nationals of Commonwealth countries who have the right to work in the UK
nationals of the EU, Switzerland, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein and family members of those nationalities with settled or pre-settled status under the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS) (opens in a new window)
nationals of the EU, Switzerland, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein and family members of those nationalities who have made a valid application for settled or pre-settled status under the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS)
individuals with limited leave to remain or indefinite leave to remain who were eligible to apply for EUSS on or before 31 December 2020
Turkish nationals, and certain family members of Turkish nationals, who have accrued the right to work in the Civil Service


Further information on nationality requirements (opens in a new window)

Working for the Civil Service

The Civil Service Code (opens in a new window) sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles (opens in a new window).

The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.

The Civil Service also offers a Redeployment Interview Scheme to civil servants who are at risk of redundancy, and who meet the minimum requirements for the advertised vacancy.

Diversity and Inclusion

The Civil Service is committed to attract, retain and invest in talent wherever it is found. To learn more please see the Civil Service People Plan (opens in a new window) and the Civil Service Diversity and Inclusion Strategy (opens in a new window).

This vacancy is part of the Great Place to Work for Veterans (opens in a new window) initiative.

The Civil Service welcomes applications from people who have recently left prison or have an unspent conviction. Read more about prison leaver recruitment (opens in new window).

Contact point for applicants

Job Contact :


Name : Jamie Wright
Email : recruitment@ofgem.gov.uk


Recruitment team

Further information

Appointment to the Civil Service is governed by the Civil Service Commission‚Äôs Recruitment Principles. You have the right to complain if you feel there has been a breach of these Recruitment Principles.

In the first instance, you should raise the matter directly via recruitment@ofgem.gov.uk. If you are not satisfied with the response, you may bring your complaint to the Commission. For further information on bringing a complaint to the Civil Service Commission, please visit their website.

  • Extensive experience of using data visualisation software such as Power BI to develop reports and dashboards. (Lead criteria)
  • Experience working with complex data models (ideally in Azure Synapse), writing SQL to manipulate and transform data, in order to create semantic models optimised for Power BI consumption.
  • Good communication skills, ability to explain technical concepts and confident in presenting insights to both technical and non-technical users.

Desirable Criteria

  • Experience working in an agile team with ability to manage multiple work items and prioritise effectively.
  • Certification in Power BI.

Behaviours

We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:

  • Changing and Improving
  • Making Effective Decisions
  • Working Together

Technical skills

We'll assess you against these technical skills during the selection process:

  • At interview, you will be presented with a technical scenario to work through and discuss with the panel. Follow-up questions will be included. No prior preparation is required.

Alongside your salary of ¬£34,123, OFGEM contributes ¬£9,885 towards you being a member of the Civil Service Defined Benefit Pension scheme. Find out what benefits a Civil Service Pension provides.

Ofgem can offer you a comprehensive and competitive benefits package which includes; 30 days annual leave after 2 years; Excellent training and development opportunities; The opportunity to join the generous Civil Service pension which also includes a valuable range of benefits; hybrid working (currently 1 day a week in the office but this is kept under review), flexible working hours and family friendly policies. Plus lots of other benefits including clean and bright offices based centrally, engaged networks and teams and an opportunity to contribute to our ambitious and important targets of establishing a Net Zero energy system by 2050. This exciting blend of professional challenge and personal reward identifies career opportunities at Ofgem as something to get excited about.

Selection process details

This vacancy is using Success Profiles (opens in a new window), and will assess your Behaviours, Ability, Experience and Technical skills.

When you press the ‚ÄòApply now‚Äô button, you will be directed to two Civil Service tests ‚Äì guidance for these can be found here Civil Service online tests - GOV.UK (www.gov.uk). Upon passing the tests, you will be asked to complete the full application, which includes uploading a copy of your anonymised CV and your 1250-word personal statement.

The 1250 word ‚Äòpersonal statement' should evidence how you meet the essential and desirable skills listed in the role profile. Please ensure you demonstrate clearly, within your supporting statement, how you meet each of the essential and desirable skills and capabilities.

The Civil Service values honesty and integrity and expects all candidates to abide by these principles. You must ensure that any evidence submitted as part of your application or used during interview, including your CV and any statements or examples, are truthful and factually accurate. Ofgem takes any incidences of cheating very seriously. Please ensure all examples provided are of your own experience. Any instances of plagiarism or other forms of cheating will be investigated and, if proven, the relevant applications will be withdrawn from the process. Please note that plagiarism can include presenting the ideas and experiences of others, or generated by artificial intelligence, as your own.

Please refer to Civil Service candidate advice on the acceptable use of artificial intelligence within the recruitment and selection process - Artificial intelligence and recruitment , Civil Service Careers

The personal information we have collected from you will be shared with Cifas who will use it to prevent fraud, other unlawful or dishonest conduct, malpractice, and other seriously improper conduct. If any of these are detected, you could be refused certain services or employment. Your personal information will also be used to verify your identity. Further details of how your information will be used by us and Cifas, and your data protection rights, can be found by [https://www.cifas.org.uk/fpn].

Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.

This vacancy is using Success Profiles (opens in a new window), and will assess your Behaviours, Ability, Experience and Technical skills.

Security

Successful candidates must undergo a criminal record check.

People working with government assets must complete baseline personnel security standard (opens in new window) checks.

Successful candidates must undergo a criminal record check.

People working with government assets must complete baseline personnel security standard (opens in new window) checks.

Nationality requirements

This Job Is Broadly Open To The Following Groups:

  • UK nationals
  • nationals of the Republic of Ireland
  • nationals of Commonwealth countries who have the right to work in the UK
  • nationals of the EU, Switzerland, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein and family members of those nationalities with settled or pre-settled status under the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS) (opens in a new window)
  • nationals of the EU, Switzerland, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein and family members of those nationalities who have made a valid application for settled or pre-settled status under the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS)
  • individuals with limited leave to remain or indefinite leave to remain who were eligible to apply for EUSS on or before 31 December 2020
  • Turkish nationals, and certain family members of Turkish nationals, who have accrued the right to work in the Civil Service

Further information on nationality requirements (opens in a new window)

Working for the Civil Service

The Civil Service Code (opens in a new window) sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles (opens in a new window).

The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.

The Civil Service also offers a Redeployment Interview Scheme to civil servants who are at risk of redundancy, and who meet the minimum requirements for the advertised vacancy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My leading Financial Services client are looking for a Data Analyst to join their CLM and KYC team, within their Data & MI space. You'll be responsible for the production and maintenance of the Data & MI function, including uploading and oversight to the internal reporting repository.




This is a newly created role within a hugely growing area of the organisation. They are a supportive and high performing team, a brilliant opportunity!




The following skills / experience is required:

Analyst background
Good experience on Pivot tables, VLookups, etc
Power BI, SQL, Python is desirable
Previously worked in Financial Services or similar industry is desirable
Excellent communication skills




Salary: Up to ¬£50,000 + bonus + package

Grade: Associate

Location: London (good work from home options available)




If you are interested and meet the above requirements please apply immediately.

Title: Junior BI Analyst
Description:
Overview: The position of Junior BI Analyst is an entry-level role. The role will include managing ad-hoc reporting/visualization tasks for production, sales, client reporting and more functions in the company.




Description:

Design & implement reports, dashboards, and visualizations using data visualization business intelligence tools
Optimize reporting dashboards with a focus on user experience, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardization
Working closely with stakeholders to understand requirements and provide the best possible solution
Make complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around you through effective communication, planning and strategic execution
Maintain documentation for design, development and reporting work
Work within our systems and with BI team members to achieve high standards of data integrity, ensuring supporting metrics are accurate and complete
Working within team processes, data governance and security frameworks




Required Skills:

At least 1 year of experience working in a BI environment
Experience using Business Intelligence tools, such as Tableau or PowerBI
Experience in creating interactive dashboards
Minimum Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent / in the process of completing those studies.
Ability to learn new skills quickly
Ability to maintain professionalism, focus and result-orientation under pressure and tight deadlines
Attention to detail
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) in English
Exceptional problem-solving/critical thinking skills
Experience working in a corporate environment




Desired Skills:

Exposure to Knime, Request Tracker (RT), Snowflake
Prior translation industry experience
Understanding of relational databases
Fluency in a foreign language







By applying, I confirm I have read and accept TransPerfect's Privacy Policy: https://www.transperfect.com/about/data-privacy-recruiting

Title: Investment Data Analyst
Description:

¬£550-650/day outside IR35

6-month contract

London-based - hybrid working




MUST have experience with investment data (fixed income financial instruments, swaps & derivatives and associated data).




Working with a financial services client who are looking for an Investment Data Analyst to enhance their investment data analysis capabilities, help drive improvements in data quality and assist with the adoption of modern investment data management.

Financial security/asset data

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst | Fast-Growing SaaS Scale-Up | ¬£40K‚Äì¬£50K | London (hybrid)




About the Company:

Our client is a rapidly growing SaaS scale-up based in London, employing a team of 50 talented professionals who are passionate about transforming industries through software innovation. They specialise in delivering advanced software solutions tailored to the needs of a diverse, expanding client base. Focused on staying ahead of the curve, the company leverages the latest technologies and fosters a culture of continuous improvement, establishing itself as a frontrunner in the SaaS field.




About the Role:

The Data Analyst role presents an exciting opportunity for individuals interested in data management and analysis. In this position, you‚Äôll be responsible for extracting, cleaning, and analysing large datasets to deliver actionable insights that inform business decisions and contribute to the development of top-tier SaaS products. With comprehensive training and development resources, this role allows you to grow your analytical abilities and become proficient with advanced data tools in a fast-paced, agile setting. The ideal candidate will be highly analytical, detail-focused, and eager to drive data-informed decisions.




Responsibilities:

Extracting data from primary and secondary sources, then reorganizing this data in a format that can be easily read by either human or machine.
Using statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts.
Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
Collaborating with engineering and product development teams to implement and refine data collection techniques.
Assisting in the design and implementation of databases and data collection systems.
Ensuring data integrity and accuracy in all analytics activities.
Participating in ongoing education and training to stay abreast of industry developments and advancements in data analysis tools and techniques.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field is required.
Experience with data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Proficiency with statistical analysis tools (e.g., SAS, SPSS, R) and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Effective communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.




Benefits:

A competitive salary range of ¬£40,000 to ¬£50,000 with potential for bonuses.
Extensive career development opportunities, including significant training in advanced data science techniques and tools.
Access to the latest tools and technologies in data science.
Regular team events, workshops, and networking opportunities.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Location: London (Hybrid working available)
Salary: ¬£50,000

Why Apply?
Are you interested in joining an Insurtech Unicorn Shaping the Future of Insurance?

Our client is a fast scaling Insurtech Unicorn that's revolutionising the insurance space through technology, data, and innovation. With millions in revenue already generated through cutting edge digital products and brand new initiatives in the pipeline, this is the perfect opportunity for a results driven, commercially sharp BI professional ready to take on real impact.

You'll be part of a growing data team and play a crucial role in building out the company's BI capability. Working with modern tooling like Looker, Snowflake, and dbt, you'll help define what great looks like for analytics at scale in a regulated, high growth environment.


Responsibilities:

Develop, maintain, and optimise self serve dashboards and reports to track core business metrics across teams.
Conduct ad hoc analysis to support business questions, hypothesis testing, and problem solving, presenting findings in an accessible format.
Collaborate with analytics engineers and data engineers to ensure data quality, usability, and documentation within data pipelines and modelling tools.
Partner with stakeholders to understand their data needs, foster trust in analytics outputs, and deliver training or documentation to improve data literacy.
Identify opportunities to streamline data workflows and reporting processes, implementing automation where possible to reduce manual effort.

Requirements:

2+ professional experience in BI, data analytics, or a related analytical role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying data and experience with BI platforms such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Strong curiosity and ability to find patterns and tell stories through data visualisation and clear communication.
Organised with excellent time management skills, able to handle multiple priorities with accuracy and attention to detail.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, capable of explaining technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Enthusiastic about leveraging AI and automation technologies to enhance analytical workflows and efficiency.


We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief.

Title: Data Engineer - Quant Research- Hedge Fund - $350k
Company: Paragon Alpha - Hedge Fund Talent Business
Description:
Paragon are partnered with a systematic hedge fund trading quant equities and credit, who rely on data driven processes to inform their strategies.




The role requires scaling and augmenting a research data platform, and helping to create a system that can integrate vast and disparate data-sets into one locations, allowing Quant Researchers to easily access.




Stack: Python, AWS, Airflow, ETL




The team is partnering with tier one Quant Traders and Researchers, and would allow you to push yourself technically and professionally. They need an excellent technologist with a trading background, and some who can understand the data quants need and why.




If you would like the chance to work with some of the worlds best technologists and investment professionals, then please do apply.

Title: Junior Data Engineer (Remote)
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

dbt Labs is the pioneer of analytics engineering, helping data teams transform raw data into reliable, actionable insights. As a Data Engineer, you'll design, build, and maintain core components of our data ecosystem, which is essential for enabling analytics and improving operational efficiency across the business.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Design, build, and maintain reliable, scalable data pipelines using dbt to support analytics and operational use cases.

‚Ä¢ Implement and enforce standards that ensure high data quality, consistency, and reliability across our internal data ecosystem.

‚Ä¢ Optimize query performance, manage compute costs, and ensure low-latency data access for downstream users.

‚Ä¢ Continuously evaluate and enhance existing systems, proactively identifying and resolving technical debt and bottlenecks.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with analysts, business stakeholders, and engineers to understand data requirements and deliver relevant and sustainable solutions.

‚Ä¢ Build automation into data workflows to reduce manual overhead and improve data freshness, lineage tracking, and monitoring.

‚Ä¢ Provide product feedback by ‚Äúdogfooding‚Äù new data infrastructure and AI technology.




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ Are an expert in SQL and Python

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience as a data engineer, and 4+ years of total experience in software engineering (including data engineering roles)

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in at least one additional core Data Engineering language such as Scala, Java or Rust

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with modern orchestration tools like Airflow, Dagster, or Prefect

‚Ä¢ A bias for action‚Äîable to stay focused and prioritize effectively




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Experience developing and scaling dbt projects

‚Ä¢ Have worked in a SaaS or high-growth tech environment

‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of open table formats (such as Apache Iceberg)




Company:

dbt Labs is a data analytics software company that develops tools for transforming and managing data within cloud data warehouses. Founded in 2016, the company is headquartered in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA, with a team of 501-1000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. dbt Labs has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

‚Ä¢ Build automation into data workflows to reduce manual overhead and improve data freshness, lineage tracking, and monitoring.

‚Ä¢ Provide product feedback by ‚Äúdogfooding‚Äù new data infrastructure and AI technology.


Qualifications:


Required:

‚Ä¢ Are an expert in SQL and Python

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience as a data engineer, and 4+ years of total experience in software engineering (including data engineering roles)

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in at least one additional core Data Engineering language such as Scala, Java or Rust

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with modern orchestration tools like Airflow, Dagster, or Prefect

‚Ä¢ A bias for action‚Äîable to stay focused and prioritize effectively


Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Experience developing and scaling dbt projects

‚Ä¢ Have worked in a SaaS or high-growth tech environment

‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of open table formats (such as Apache Iceberg)


Company:

dbt Labs is a data analytics software company that develops tools for transforming and managing data within cloud data warehouses. Founded in 2016, the company is headquartered in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA, with a team of 501-1000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. dbt Labs has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

ektello is an online marketplace for vacation rentals and short-term stays, and they are seeking a Senior Data Analyst for their Trust & Safety team. The role involves working with various data sources to identify, analyze, visualize, and interpret trends to solve business problems, collaborating with technical stakeholders, and creating dashboards to share insights.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Partner with the business to understand the organization and its goals in order to ensure prioritization of highest impact initiatives.

‚Ä¢ Define, create and visualize metrics for problem definition for tracking project success/workstream health.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with technical owners to deliver on impactful insights.

‚Ä¢ Create dashboards for weekly reporting.

‚Ä¢ Build strong relationships and trust with stakeholders, keeping them and their teams engaged in the project




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ High proficiency in Advanced SQL and Airflow for developing queries and data pipelines

‚Ä¢ Working knowledge and understanding of Experiments, Causation & Correlation, and Statistical models (eg. regression, Chi-square etc.)

‚Ä¢ Experience with Superset, Tableau, or similar BI platform to develop reports and dashboards

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently with stakeholders, write requirements, and solve analytical problems in fast-paced, ambiguous environments

‚Ä¢ Able to serve as a liaison between business and technical teams to drive effective, timely solutions, insights to actions, that fulfill both strategic and operational needs

‚Ä¢ Able to team effectively with others and build relationships at all levels, both within the team and with stakeholders




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Experience with Trust & Safety domain, ML models, and metrics

‚Ä¢ Experience with Big Data/Analytics platforms/languages like Hive, Python, R is a big plus

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Suffolk Construction is a national enterprise that builds, innovates, and invests, focusing on providing value throughout the entire project lifecycle. The Senior Data Analyst will design, implement, and optimize analytical solutions to drive data-informed decision-making, leading complex analyses and dashboards while ensuring data governance and quality standards are met.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Lead complex, end ‚Äë to ‚Äë end analytical projects ‚Äì frame ambiguous business questions, design robust analyses across large or multi ‚Äë source data sets, and deliver clear, actionable insights that influence strategic decisions.

‚Ä¢ Translate strategic objectives into data requirements and Agile deliverables ‚Äì partner with Product Owners to refine epics, decompose them into sprint ‚Äë ready user stories with acceptance criteria, and drive their execution (analysis, development, testing, documentation) to on ‚Äë time, high ‚Äë quality delivery.

‚Ä¢ Set standards for Business ‚Äë as ‚Äë Usual (BAU) data fulfillment ‚Äì own the BAU request pipeline, automate repetitive tasks, monitor SLAs, and coach team members to ensure consistent, scalable service levels.

‚Ä¢ Partner with Data Engineering to architect and evolve analysis ‚Äë ready data models ‚Äì collaborate to define requirements, champion best practices in ELT/ETL and data ‚Äë ops, and validate that pipelines and marts meet analytical needs for accuracy, timeliness, and cost efficiency.

‚Ä¢ Drive self ‚Äë directed deep ‚Äë dive analyses that uncover growth and efficiency opportunities ‚Äì proactively surface hypotheses, design experiments or statistical tests, and translate findings into prioritized recommendations with quantified impact.

‚Ä¢ Influence and align senior stakeholders ‚Äì craft executive ‚Äë ready narratives and visualizations, present findings to leadership, and build consensus on data ‚Äë driven initiatives, investment decisions, and KPI definitions.

‚Ä¢ Elevate team capability ‚Äì mentor analysts on analytical design, coding standards, QA, and storytelling; share best practices; and foster a culture of continuous improvement and knowledge sharing across functions.




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or related fields.

‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in data space, with a minimum of 2 years as a Data Analyst with a proven track record managing complex pipelines or systems, consistently delivering high-performance ratings, and impactful contributions to business efficiency.

‚Ä¢ Advanced proficiency in data visualization frameworks (at least one enterprise BI platform - Tableau or Power BI; with some code-first JavaScript, Python, or R).

‚Ä¢ Advanced proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data manipulation and automation.

‚Ä¢ Intermediate understanding of data engineering (e.g., ETL processes, database optimization).

‚Ä¢ Advanced statistical analysis and problem-solving.




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Advanced degree is preferred.

‚Ä¢ Experience with project ‚Äë based, asset ‚Äë heavy industries (construction, real estate development, infrastructure) is strongly preferred.

‚Ä¢ Experience in the construction subcontractor/ self-perform industry will be a strong differentiator.




Company:

Suffolk Construction is a construction contracting company. Founded in 1982, the company is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, USA, with a team of 1001-5000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. Suffolk Construction has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Nasuni is a company that delivers a unified data platform for enterprises managing unstructured data. They are seeking a motivated Data Engineer to join their Data & Analytics team, responsible for building and optimizing data infrastructure that supports reporting, analysis, and machine learning across the company.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Administer and optimize data pipelines and Snowflake platform, including warehouse sizing, query tuning, and access control policies

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain robust data transformation pipelines, leveraging data from both APIs and file-based sources

‚Ä¢ Leverage tools like dbt and Snowflake data transformations

‚Ä¢ Design, manage, and monitor data pipelines that move structured and unstructured data from multiple sources into Snowflake, ensuring reliability, performance, and cost-efficiency

‚Ä¢ Contribute to the infrastructure design and software lifecycle phases‚Äîincluding technical design, testing, implementation, and quality assurance

‚Ä¢ Provide proactive support for critical production systems, resolving pipeline or performance issues quickly and effectively

‚Ä¢ Partner with dashboard developers, analysts, and other stakeholders to support analytical, operational, and reporting needs across Nasuni

‚Ä¢ Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and demonstrate DevOps best practices




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field

‚Ä¢ 2-5 years of experience in a data engineering or data platform role with a focus on database performance and pipeline reliability

‚Ä¢ Strong SQL and Python development and optimization skills

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience administering and developing in Snowflake, including warehouse scaling, role-based access, and usage monitoring

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in building and maintaining data pipelines into Snowflake, using tools like Fivetran (or equivalent)

‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of ELT/ETL concepts and data architecture best practices across cloud and hybrid systems

‚Ä¢ Ability to work autonomously and as a team in a fast paced environment

‚Ä¢ High level of attention to detail with the ability to multi-task effectively

‚Ä¢ High degree of professionalism and ability to maintain confidential information

‚Ä¢ Excellent organizational and time management skills

‚Ä¢ Aptitude and ability to apply academic or applied experience in software development or data engineering related field

‚Ä¢ An advanced understanding of modern ELT practices, database development, SQL and query optimizations, stored procedures, views, and other db objects

‚Ä¢ Able to design data solutions to allow for cost-effective, scalable, fast, and flexible solutions to support front-end development, analyst work, and data health and monitoring needs

‚Ä¢ Able to pick up quickly and think both creatively and critically to solve problems

‚Ä¢ A team-player that collaborates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders




Company:

Nasuni is a cloud storage company that provides hybrid cloud-based storage and file-sharing platforms to manage file growth. Founded in 2009, the company is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, USA, with a team of 501-1000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. Nasuni has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: IT Service Desk Analyst (Greater Boston or Vermont)
Description:
About Power Factors:

Power Factors is a software and solutions provider leading the next generation of clean energy with Unity, one of the most extensive and widely deployed renewable energy management suites (REMS) in the market. With over 300 GW of wind, solar, and energy storage assets managed worldwide across more than 600 customers and 18,000 sites, Power Factors manages 25% of the world's renewable energy data.

Power Factors' Unity REMS supports the entire energy value chain, from monitoring and controls to market analytics. The company's suite of open, data-driven applications empowers renewable energy stakeholders to collaborate, automate critical workflows, and make more informed decisions to maximize asset returns. Energy stakeholders receive end-to-end support, including solutions for SCADA & PPC, centralized monitoring, performance management, commercial asset management, and field service management.

With deep domain expertise, AI-powered insights are delivered at scale so businesses can optimize assets, unlock growth, and make smarter decisions as the world rapidly transitions to clean energy. Power Factors fights climate change with code.


Outside China and India‚ÄØ


Position Summary:

Power Factors is seeking a proactive and customer-focused IT Service Desk Analyst to join our IT team. This role is the first point of contact for internal users experiencing technical issues. You will be responsible for providing Level 1 support, resolving incidents, and escalating complex issues as needed. The ideal candidate will have strong troubleshooting skills, excellent communication abilities, and a passion for delivering high-quality IT support.

Responsibilities


Serve as the first point of contact for users seeking technical assistance Teams, email, or ticketing system
Diagnosing and resolving hardware, software, and network issues
Log all incidents and service requests accurately in the Fresh Service ticketing system.
Follow up with users to ensure issues are resolved and document solutions for future reference
Assist with onboarding/offboarding tasks including account setup, hardware provisioning, and access rights.
Maintain knowledge base articles and contribute to continuous improvement of support documentation
Participate in IT projects and initiatives as needed


Required Qualifications


Demonstrate a strong willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and tools
Actively seek opportunities to expand technical knowledge through training, certifications, and hands-on experience
Collaborate with team members to share knowledge and support continuous improvement
Proficiency with Windows and macOS environments, Microsoft 365, Active Directory, and common enterprise applications
Strong communication and problem-solving skills
A self-starter with a growth mindset and eagerness to learn
Must own a car and be able to commute to the Vermont and Waltham office locations as needed.


Good To Have


1-2 years of experience in a service desk or IT support role
A+ or ITIL Foundation certification
Power Shell or any scripting experience
Experience with Fresh Service, Service now or any other ticketing system


WHY JOIN US

By joining the Power Factors team, you'll be part of a dynamic group of innovative and driven individuals dedicated to making a positive impact. Every day, your work will directly contribute to advancing clean energy solutions and supporting global sustainability initiatives. Our culture runs deep and shows up in how we work together - committed, conscientious and collaborative. With many opportunities for professional growth, Power Factors is here to support your development as we lead the charge in transforming the energy industry.

WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Power Factors is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to engaging a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Title: Data Engineer II
Description:
Premise Health is Different on Purpose

Premise Health serves large organizations and their people with exceptional healthcare. The result? Better experiences, better health, and better value, all while helping organizations lower their healthcare costs.

Premise's mission is to help people get, stay, and be well. Come join us and see for yourself why amazing health starts with amazing healthcare. For more information, visit www.jobs.premisehealth.com.

The Data Engineer II will be responsible for building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines, managing our azure delta lake architecture, and supporting analytics initiatives across the organization. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Azure Databricks, data engineering, and develops pipeline. The successful candidate will work closely with our platform architects and data science teams to ensure seamless integration of data pipelines and Lakehouse architecture. This role should ensure coding standard and coding migration to higher environment and CI/CD.

This is a Full Time, Remote Data Engineer II role.

What You'll Do


Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines using Azure Databricks, Apache Spark, and Python.
Collaborate with data engineering teams to integrate data from EPIC, Clarity, and Caboodle and other on-premise source systems to Azure.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security throughout the data pipeline.
Automate unit test cases as part of Data Pipeline.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of our Lakehouse architecture using Azure Databricks and Delta Lake.
Ensure data governance and security in the Lakehouse environment
Should be able to execute POCs to evaluate new tool, concepts introduced by Azure/ Databricks.
Troubleshoot data pipeline and Lakehouse architecture issues, identifying and resolving bottlenecks and errors.
Optimize data pipeline and Lakehouse architecture performance, scalability, cost and reliability.
Collaborate with data science teams to integrate data pipelines and Lakehouse architecture with data science workflows.
Ensure seamless data exchange between data engineering and data science teams.
Participate in peer review for coding standards.
Subject matter expert for pySpark and Scala.
Other duties as assigned.


What You'll Bring


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Cisco CCNP, Microsoft Azure Solutions Architect, or ITIL preferred.
Databricks and Azure certification preferred.
5+ years of experience in Cloud development practice.
Strong expertise in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), virtualization, and networking.
Preferred experience with infrastructure automation tools (Terraform, Ansible, Kubernetes).
Proficiency in Linux and Windows server administration.
Solid knowledge of cybersecurity best practices and disaster recovery planning.
Strong leadership experience in managing technical teams and project management skills.
Knowledge of log management and monitoring tools (Splunk, Datadog, Prometheus).
Knowledge on Talend, Power BI and Qlik
Familiarity with containerization and microservices


Work-life balance is at the foundation of how decisions are made and where Premise is headed. We can only help people get, stay, and be well if we do the same for ourselves. In addition to competitive pay, Premise offers full-time team members benefits including medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, a 401(k) program with company match, paid holidays and vacation time, a company-sponsored wellness program, EAP, access to virtual primary care and virtual behavioral health at no cost for team members and their dependents. Additional benefits can be viewed here: https://jobs.premisehealth.com/benefits.

Premise is an equal opportunity employer; we value inclusion and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex (including pregnancy and related conditions), gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.

Premise provides its reasonable and genuinely expected range of compensation for this job of $105,000.00 - $120,000.00 annually. A number of factors will influence the rate offered for this position, including your experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other factors.

For individuals living in Washington or Colorado: Premise offers the following paid time off benefits. Employees will earn 0.0692 hours of paid time off per actual hours worked or based on standard schedule, per pay period, and will receive 10 paid holidays or an equivalent bank of hours aligned to schedule throughout the calendar year. Paid sick leave is satisfied by the paid time off accrual, detailed above.

This posting is anticipated to close within 10 days of 08/04/2025.

The Data Engineer II will be responsible for building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines, managing our azure delta lake architecture, and supporting analytics initiatives across the organization. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Azure Databricks, data engineering, and develops pipeline. The successful candidate will work closely with our platform architects and data science teams to ensure seamless integration of data pipelines and Lakehouse architecture. This role should ensure coding standard and coding migration to higher environment and CI/CD.

This is a Full Time, Remote Data Engineer II role.

What You'll Do

  • Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines using Azure Databricks, Apache Spark, and Python.
  • Collaborate with data engineering teams to integrate data from EPIC, Clarity, and Caboodle and other on-premise source systems to Azure.
  • Ensure data quality, integrity, and security throughout the data pipeline.
  • Automate unit test cases as part of Data Pipeline.
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of our Lakehouse architecture using Azure Databricks and Delta Lake.
  • Ensure data governance and security in the Lakehouse environment
  • Should be able to execute POCs to evaluate new tool, concepts introduced by Azure/ Databricks.
  • Troubleshoot data pipeline and Lakehouse architecture issues, identifying and resolving bottlenecks and errors.
  • Optimize data pipeline and Lakehouse architecture performance, scalability, cost and reliability.
  • Collaborate with data science teams to integrate data pipelines and Lakehouse architecture with data science workflows.
  • Ensure seamless data exchange between data engineering and data science teams.
  • Participate in peer review for coding standards.
  • Subject matter expert for pySpark and Scala.
  • Other duties as assigned.

What You'll Bring

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • Certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Cisco CCNP, Microsoft Azure Solutions Architect, or ITIL preferred.
  • Databricks and Azure certification preferred.
  • 5+ years of experience in Cloud development practice.
  • Strong expertise in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), virtualization, and networking.
  • Preferred experience with infrastructure automation tools (Terraform, Ansible, Kubernetes).
  • Proficiency in Linux and Windows server administration.
  • Solid knowledge of cybersecurity best practices and disaster recovery planning.
  • Strong leadership experience in managing technical teams and project management skills.
  • Knowledge of log management and monitoring tools (Splunk, Datadog, Prometheus).
  • Knowledge on Talend, Power BI and Qlik
  • Familiarity with containerization and microservices

Title: System Administrator
Description:
Company Description

Customized Energy Solutions (CES), a privately-held company, is a leading service provider of market intelligence and operational support services to companies participating in the retail and wholesale electric and natural gas markets. Utilizing deep know-how developed since the inception of the deregulated energy markets, CES provides accurate & timely analysis on regulatory changes, market opportunities, and operational efficiencies for electricity and natural gas commodities. CES is also a third-party asset manager of more than 13,000 MWs of renewable and conventional generation resources across all ISOs in the United States, Ontario, Canada and Guam. CES empowers clients to achieve their goals by helping them navigate the evolving energy markets, complex market rules, and new energy technologies.

Join a rapidly growing company in an exciting and dynamic work environment. As one of the top 100 fastest growing companies in the Philadelphia region, Customized Energy Solutions offers an opportunity for significant professional growth.

Customized Energy Solutions Ltd. has been recognized regionally and nationally for its impressive and sustained growth, including INC. 500 | 5000 and The Philadelphia Business Journal as a Top 100 Companies in Philadelphia, Hall of Fame for five or more consecutive years. It was ranked as one of the ‚ÄúBest Places to Work‚Äù by the Philadelphia Business Journal.

Our team of associates at CES is highly motivated, innovative, and passionate about providing excellent Services to our clients. We look for individuals interested in growing with our company, and working in an exciting, open and collegial work environment. Our main office is in Philadelphia, with satellite offices in various U.S. states, Canada, Japan, India and Vietnam.

Job Description

The Systems Administrator will play an important role in overseeing various technical administrative responsibilities within the organization. This position will be primarily responsible for maintaining a variety of industry leading network monitoring and management tools and utilities. The individual filling this role will interact and coordinate with internal client teams to enable improved awareness and visibility into the status and performance of network, server, and cloud infrastructure. Additionally, this role will be responsible for managing hands-on network and infrastructure support tasks in the Philadelphia metro area. The Systems and Network Administrator will address technical needs and maintain vigilance over system availability. The candidate filling this role will function as an escalation path for support of technology-related issues and will support the Infrastructure Services team including rotating on-call schedule. This is an on-site position.

Job Responsibilities


Configure, manage, and maintain enterprise network management, monitoring, and auditing tools to ensure optimal system performance, availability, and alerting.
Oversee the implementation and ongoing management of enterprise password and secrets management tool.
Develop and customize dashboards, alerts, and reports for effective monitoring and reporting of enterprise systems.
Ensure accurate logging and auditing of network activities in accordance with organizational policies.
Integrate Service Desk Application with automation and monitoring tools to streamline workflows and automate processes.
Support and manage the Security Suite for incident response, vulnerability scanning, and security operations center (SOC) integration.
Deploy and manage the enterprise vulnerability management and patching platform for hosted vulnerability and patch management across various systems.
Administer Microsoft SCCM, InTune, and AutoPilot for build automation, mobile device management (MDM), and device provisioning.


Qualifications


Minimum of 5 years‚Äô experience in IT infrastructure, monitoring systems administration, or related roles.
Hands-on experience with and relevant certifications in the listed tools, especially SolarWinds Orion, Delinea Secret Server, Rapid7, Automox, Microsoft Modern Desktop Administrator, SCCM, Intune, AutoPilot, or comparable industry accepted solutions.
Proven ability to develop integrations and automation between various IT tools.
Knowledge of scripting and automation (e.g., PowerShell, Python) to enhance system integrations.
Strong understanding of network monitoring, auditing, security operations, and ITSM processes.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Ability to understand and follow documentation, repeat existing processes and create new documentation.
Ability to work effectively in a team and individually with minimal supervision.


Additional Information

At Customized Energy Solutions, we offer a competitive salary based on experience, along with comprehensive benefits like performance-based bonuses, comprehensive health coverage, and tuition reimbursement to support your ongoing growth and success

Customized Energy Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Associate Planner
Description:
Sisley Paris is a French cosmetics company that specializes in creating and distributing high-end skincare, make-up products, and fine perfumes. It is currently sold in high-end retail distribution in the US & Canada such as Neiman Marcus, Nordstrom, Saks Fifth Avenue, Bloomingdales, Holt Renfrew & Blue Mercury, as well as online, spas and owned retail. The brand retails over $100M annually and is experiencing double digits growth.




Founded in 1976 by Hubert d‚ÄôOrnano, Sisley was a pioneer in using botanical active ingredients and essential oils in beauty products. With a rigorous approach to research and a focus on Phyto-Cosmetology, Sisley offers innovative and high-quality products.¬†The Company upholds five core values: Collaborative, Mindful of others, Entrepreneurial, Responsible, and Organized. These values are at the heart of everything we do and inspire our employees to embody them in every aspect of their work.¬†




Luxury French cosmetics brand, Sisley-Paris, is looking for an extraordinary Associate Planner to join our Sales Development Team. The Associate Planner will be focused on sales planning and managing the relationship between Sisley and the retailer‚Äôs buying department. This role involves building relationships with retailers and excellent ability in negotiation and execution.¬†Ideal candidates will have 1 ‚Äì 3 years of experience in assistant buying and/or planning, preferably in the retail industry.




Core Responsibilities:

General:

Must be an analytical, independent thinker with hands-on, can-do, ‚Äúroll up your sleeves‚Äù attitude, an open-minded team player with a collaborative attitude.
Must be highly organized, detail-oriented, and can thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented and high-energy environment.
Ability to work well in a team environment but flexible working independently, meeting goals and deadlines.




Inventory Management:

Develop and maintain sales and inventory plans to maximize sales and profitability.
Monitor stock rotation on a monthly basis.
Analyze and react to sales trends by account and by product collection
Ensure that retail stores have the right amount of stock by analyzing sales data, identifying trends, and planning inventory levels.




Building relationships:

Be point of contact with the retailer‚Äôs buying department.
Execute brand strategies with the retailer.
Explore new business opportunities together with the retailer‚Äôs buying department.




Reporting:

Run, analyze and publish weekly and monthly sales reporting.
Build accurate forecasts and achieve the accounts results.
Create detailed analyses of sales reports to identify internal influences on sales performance.
Complete allocations by account and by door for retail and non-retail products.
Create store branching reports for upper management.
Special projects, as needed.




Required Experience and Skills:

1-3 years of assistant buying or planning experience in the retail industry.
The ability to build collaborative relationships internally and externally is key.
Allocation experience.¬†
Strong working knowledge of basic retail math and formulas.¬†
A strong attention to detail.
Goal and performance driven/motivated.
Excel and BI systems, general experience with MS Office.
Professional attitude, diplomacy, and ability to handle difficult situations with respect.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Highly organized with ability to prioritize and manage deadlines.
Self-motivated with ability to take initiative.




[Salary range - $60,000 - $65,000]

Title: Information Technology Coordinator (Grade 12)
Description:
Nature of Work

THE CITY OF HUNTSVILLE'S INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY SERVICES DEPARTMENT WANTS YOU!

The City of Huntsville's I.T.S. department is seeking qualified applicants to fill our

Information Technology Coordinator position.

Exciting Opportunities for Smart and Talented People.

Come join our growing I.T.S. Team! Apply today!

About Our Department

The Information Technology Service Department's primary responsibilities are in the areas of providing information technology, developing and implementing recommended standards for information technology, developing and maintaining security policies and systems and coordinating the acquisition of information technology for all City Departments. Our goal is to provide the best data processing services to the City through the effective utilization of existing and new information technology. The ITS Department will implement and support technologies and processes that will increase service to City employees and enhance staff productivity.

Information Technology Coordinator Position Overview

This is administrative and technical work involving coordination of inventory and installation of computer hardware and software or telephone communications equipment including radios, data lines, and pagers and providing support to users. Work involves managing and maintaining computer hardware and software or telephone communications equipment inventory. Coordinates installation of equipment and software. Assists users with computer and telephone equipment and software operation. Work is performed with some independence for initiative, judgment and action, and is reviewed for adherence to policies and procedures, accuracy and completeness and for results achieved.

Qualifications And Necessary Special Requirements

High school diploma from a school accredited by a regional accrediting agency recognized by the U.S. Department of Education or GED certificate issued by the appropriate state agency, supplemented by college level courses in computer science or a related field and experience in the field of information or communication technology; or any combination of education, training and experience.

Valid Driver's License

Must submit to fingerprinting background check

For More Information Regarding the Information Technology Coordinator Job Duties, Please Visit the Websites Below:

https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/huntsville/classspecs/81985

Title: Technical Support Specialist
Description:
Description

Technical Support Specialist

Sangoma, a leader in business communications solutions, is seeking a dedicated Technical Support Specialist to join our team. With a reputation built on reliability and innovation, we provide fully integrated UCaaS solutions encompassing telephony, meetings, messaging, and more. As part of our commitment to superior customer service, this role plays a crucial part in assisting our partners and customers and ensuring seamless operations across our platforms. You will be at the forefront of technical support, troubleshooting issues, and contributing to the overall enhancement of our services. If you have a passion for telecommunications and a strong technical background, we invite you to help us deliver the best solutions for our clients. We are looking for talented technical support staff to join our team. Must submit your resume in English.

Your Role


Assisting company employees with technical requests
Triaging, prioritizing and routing all issues that come into the system
Ensuring that end users are being kept up to date on their ticket status
Managing user experience items on the corporate PBX systems like desk phones and voicemail
Ensuring that shared printer/copier/scanners are maintained and online across the company
Maintaining software license documentation for the organization
Proactive management of end user laptops, desktops and mobile devices
Basic network troubleshooting, including remote connectivity issues for end users
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with end user laptops, desktops and mobile devices
Ensuring the end user devices meet security standards as laid out in corporate policy
Some systems administration oriented work
Sharing after-hours triage responsibilities with the IT team
Other duties as assigned by management


Requirements

Your Background:


Willingness to jump into unfamiliar situations, ask questions and learn
A warm, customer-service oriented, disposition
Willingness to ‚Äúown‚Äù a problem from initial report until final resolution
Must demonstrate a high proficiency in technical troubleshooting
Installing/configuring software and hardware on laptops, desktops and mobile devices
Managing inventory of company laptops, desktops and mobile devices
Familiarity with common end-user applications including: Chrome/Firefox, gSuite, MS Office suite, etc
Above average verbal and written communication skills
Fluent in English
2 year certificate or degree from an accredited institution


Preferred Experience


Experience using Atlassian‚Äôs Jira platform for ticket management
Experience managing a VoIP PBX phone system
Experience with working on an IT team or on in a helpdesk type situation
Hands-on experience working with gSuite, Active Directory and anti-virus|malware platforms.
4 year degree from an accredited institution
Must have expert level written and verbal English vocational skills.


Benefits

What We Offer:


Extensive Benefit Options are effective after a short waiting period
Flexible Time Off & Company Holidays
Entrepreneurial work environment partnered with high-growth career opportunities


Apply for this job

Title: Chief Executive Officer
Description:
THE PORTFOLIO COMPANY

This PE-backed platform delivers inspection, maintenance, and installation services across fire and life safety systems, with a primary focus on the marine sector‚Äîserving commercial vessels, private yachts, cruise lines, and military ships. With operations in Oakland, Fort Lauderdale, and Los Angeles, the business is actively transitioning from marine dominance to expanding into commercial and industrial real estate fire safety services. The company has completed three acquisitions since September 2024, with ambitions to build a national platform through both M&A and organic growth.

The platform currently generates $20M in revenue with $3.3M in YTD EBITDA and a goal to reach $5M EBITDA by year-end. The long-term vision is to scale to $15‚Äì$20M EBITDA and achieve a strategic or sponsor-backed exit.




THE PRIVATE EQUITY FIRM

The firm is a first-time fund with $100M AUM, pursuing control buyouts and aggressive buy-and-build strategies across Industrials, Business Services, and Healthcare. Their investment thesis centers on professionalizing founder-led businesses and scaling platforms through focused M&A and operational improvement. The firm is hands-on early in the hold and highly supportive in execution. They invest in people, not just assets.

Other portfolio businesses include HVAC services and fire safety platforms. The team is based in Los Angeles and is deeply involved in strategy and execution‚Äîstepping in when needed and stepping back once teams are built.




THE CULTURE

The platform is in the early stages of cultural transformation. Historically founder-led and location-centric, the business is moving from a fractured C-grade culture toward a cohesive, mission-driven environment. Pride exists at the field level, particularly in marine services, but there is a strong need for leadership to instill structure, values, and accountability.

The CEO will be instrumental in driving this cultural shift‚Äîdeveloping leadership, building an outbound sales motion, professionalizing service delivery, and establishing core business functions such as HR and strategic operations.




VISION

What does success look like in this role?

Reach $5M EBITDA by year-end and $15‚Äì$20M within 3 years.
Execute a quarterly cadence of acquisitions with seamless integration.
Build and lead a high-performance team‚ÄîVP Sales, Ops Lead, VP M&A, HR Lead.
Drive cultural transformation across three locations.
Migrate from marine-dominant to diversified fire & life safety platform.
Position the company for a strategic or sponsor-led exit.




THE ROLE

The CEO will be responsible for:

Leading all aspects of the platform‚Äîstrategy, operations, financial performance, and culture.
Building and leading a team capable of scaling to $20M EBITDA.
Executing and integrating add-on acquisitions in coordination with Walk-On Capital.
Driving organic growth initiatives including outbound sales and commercial expansion.
Professionalizing all business functions: HR, service delivery, finance, and operations.
Representing the platform to the board and investors.




KEY SELLING POINTS OF THE ROLE

Lead a growing platform in a $68.5Bn+ market with strong M&A momentum.
Opportunity to build and own the story of a sponsor-backed roll-up.
High equity upside‚Äîaligned directly with the sponsor's contribution.
Supportive and execution-driven board with track record of value creation.
Be the face of a future $20M EBITDA exit with strategic and sponsor interest already validated.




KEY CHALLENGES FOR THE ROLE

First-time PE-backed business‚Äîrequires pace, structure, and vision.
Fragmented operations and inconsistent professionalism across sites.
Low process maturity‚Äîrequires hands-on transformation.
Marine sector complexity requires sensitivity to safety, regulation, and nuance.
Building trust and alignment across legacy leadership and new team.




YOUR BACKGROUND

Successful candidates will demonstrate:

Prior CEO or #2 experience in a PE-backed business.
Buy-and-build experience‚Äîdeal sourcing, diligence, and integration.
Industry experience in Fire & Life Safety, Facilities Services, or related sectors.
Proven leadership across both blue- and white-collar environments.
Track record of building high-performing teams and scaling to $10M+ EBITDA.




YOUR CHARACTERISTICS

Strategic and structured thinker with execution bias.
High ownership mindset‚Äîproactive and solutions-driven.
Servant leader with strong team-building ability.
Comfortable rolling up sleeves‚Äîlead from the front.
High emotional intelligence with disciplined leadership.




LOCATION

Flexible ‚Äì must be willing to travel weekly




COMPENSATION PACKAGE

Basic Salary: $325,000‚Äì$400,000
Bonus: 25‚Äì35%
Equity: Up to 5% of the Management Incentive Plan (MIP), fully aligned with sponsor‚Äôs contribution
Benefits: 401k, healthcare

HTML:
THE PORTFOLIO COMPANY

This PE-backed platform delivers inspection, maintenance, and installation services across fire and life safety systems, with a primary focus on the marine sector‚Äîserving commercial vessels, private yachts, cruise lines, and military ships. With operations in Oakland, Fort Lauderdale, and Los Angeles, the business is actively transitioning from marine dominance to expanding into commercial and industrial real estate fire safety services. The company has completed three acquisitions since September 2024, with ambitions to build a national platform through both M&A and organic growth.

The platform currently generates $20M in revenue with $3.3M in YTD EBITDA and a goal to reach $5M EBITDA by year-end. The long-term vision is to scale to $15‚Äì$20M EBITDA and achieve a strategic or sponsor-backed exit.


THE PRIVATE EQUITY FIRM

The firm is a first-time fund with $100M AUM, pursuing control buyouts and aggressive buy-and-build strategies across Industrials, Business Services, and Healthcare. Their investment thesis centers on professionalizing founder-led businesses and scaling platforms through focused M&A and operational improvement. The firm is hands-on early in the hold and highly supportive in execution. They invest in people, not just assets.

Other portfolio businesses include HVAC services and fire safety platforms. The team is based in Los Angeles and is deeply involved in strategy and execution‚Äîstepping in when needed and stepping back once teams are built.


THE CULTURE

The platform is in the early stages of cultural transformation. Historically founder-led and location-centric, the business is moving from a fractured C-grade culture toward a cohesive, mission-driven environment. Pride exists at the field level, particularly in marine services, but there is a strong need for leadership to instill structure, values, and accountability.

The CEO will be instrumental in driving this cultural shift‚Äîdeveloping leadership, building an outbound sales motion, professionalizing service delivery, and establishing core business functions such as HR and strategic operations.

  • High equity upside‚Äîaligned directly with the sponsor's contribution.
  • Supportive and execution-driven board with track record of value creation.
  • Be the face of a future $20M EBITDA exit with strategic and sponsor interest already validated.


KEY CHALLENGES FOR THE ROLE
