Title: Data Analyst
Description:
It's more than a job

As a Data Analyst at Kuehne+Nagel, you will play a key role in optimizing end-to-end warehousing operations by transforming raw logistics data into actionable insights. Your analytical precision will support operational efficiency and strategic decision-making across warehouse and distribution centers. For example, by analyzing trends in the storage and delivery of delicate flowers and fresh ingredients, you‚Äôll help ensure timely deliveries to local stores‚Äîcontributing to everyday lunches and family celebrations. At Kuehne+Nagel, our work truly contributes to more than we imagine.

‚Äé

As a Business Analyst, you will provide the General Manager with tools to prepare an accurate forecast including annual target and quarterly forecasts and prepare operational and financial reports for management. Initially, your schedule will be Monday - Friday, 7 am to 3:30.

How you create impact


Consolidate data, track trends, and develop suggestions to close gaps between targets and actuals for both financial and operational targets
Ensure the accuracy of KPIs and statistical information
Pull data daily and publish results to operations
Analyze discrepancies and find solutions
Support and process month-end closing reports
Prepare monthly and quarterly business review
Plan and maintain slotting in the warehouse
Support and plan layout in the warehouse including nomenclature and labeling
Other responsibilities as assigned


What we would like you to bring


High school diploma or equivalent
3 years of operational experience in logistics or a distribution center environment
1+ years of experience as a Business or Operations Analyst
Experience with SAP, Manhattan, or other Warehouse Management System (WMS)
Intermediate skills in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Access, or Tableau
Intermediate skills in Excel; ability to create and maintain complex spreadsheets


What's in it for you

There has never been a better time to work in logistics. Bring your skills to an industry that offers stability and international career growth. We offer a great compensation and medical/dental benefits package, employee discounts, tuition reimbursement, excellent training programs, and a fun, and interesting global work environment.

Who we are

Logistics shapes everyday life - from the goods we consume to the healthcare we rely on. At Kuehne+Nagel, your work goes beyond logistics; it enables both ordinary and special moments in the lives of people around the world.

As a global leader with a strong heritage and a vision to move the world forward, we offer a safe, stable environment where your career can make a real difference. Whether we help deliver life-saving medicines, develop sustainable transportation solutions or support our local communities, your career will contribute to more than you can imagine.

We kindly advise that placement agencies refrain from submitting unsolicited profiles. Any submissions of candidates without prior signed agreement will be considered our property and no fees will be paid.

Title: Digital & Data Business Analyst
Description:
Position Title: Digital & Data Business Analyst

Position Type: Regular - Full-Time

Position Location: Toronto HQ

Requisition ID: 36535

In every role, McCainers are ambitious, curious, and passionate about creating exceptional work experiences - together. With a customer-first mindset, we make doing business with McCain easy.

About The Role.

McCain has embarked on a digital transformation journey. In the past 3-5 years, global digital systems have been implemented and enable to capture lots of data from our growers and their fields. As part of this transformation, we are elevating the way that we use digital & data to drive value and enhance decision-making across our global agriculture business. Our key objective is to transform data into actionable insights and effective action plans.

McCain is an international company with a world-wide presence, with sourcing taking place in multiple key regions such as North America, South America, Europe, India, Australia-New Zealand, South Africa. Within agriculture, there are some regional specificities and nuances which make the work more challenging. This position of Global Digital & Data Business analyst will focus on McCain Grower Relationship and Sourcing activity pillar, working closely with our internal regional teams and their grower partners.

We are seeking a curious, creative and innovative data-driven individual with a proven background in analytical thinking, problem solving, and communication skills.

The Global Agriculture Digital & Data Business Analyst will play a key role in integrating a data perspective into our agriculture business processes to drive sustainable raw supply, cultivate grower relationships, and enhance sustainability and re-generative practices. This role will be key to transform our agriculture business to be a data-led business around the world. You will work with cross-functional and - regional teams, as well as our technology team to support the digital transformation roadmap. This role will focus on building operational metrics, operational reports and processes to leverage data for actionable insights and ensure decision-makers in Grower relationship and Sourcing can make data-driven decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing.


Define the right process indicators to drive improvement actions that are aligned with McCain‚Äôs Agriculture efficiency goals.
Map the data points that are required to calculate performance indicators.
Act as a global GRM (Grower Relationship Management) data lead to ensure consistency and standardization of key business data. Be the custodian of the GRM business data model.
Serve as a data subject-matter expert on GRM & sourcing business processes.
When global digital systems are implemented collaborate with the global technology and analytics team to identify data sources and ensure a seamless process for accessing the right data points.
When global digital systems are not implemented, collaborate with our regional teams to define ways to track data points in a business acceptable manner.
Propose with the Global Product Manager in charge of this pillar, the analytics and reporting strategy through PowerBI dashboards and standard reporting tools.
Design and oversee the development of intuitive, user-friendly operational dashboards that meet business needs and drive continuous improvements to increase user engagement and adoption.
Develop wireframes of analytics outputs to ensure alignment of business requirements.
Support user training and adoption of reporting tools.
Build regional business relationships to identify value-driven analytics.
Distill data to share actionable operational insights with global and regional Ag stakeholders, including GRM agriculture scorecards. Be prepared to improve data literacy across all regions.
Work with the Data Governance team to identify and support resolving data quality issues at the source and in a timely manner.
Lead medium-scale data-driven projects, in its scope of responsibility, closely collaborating with the technology, analytics and regional teams.


What You‚Äôll Need To Be Successful.


Educational background: a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data & Analytics, or a related field. A master's degree can be a plus.
Data Analysis: experience with data analysis, business data modeling, and data visualization tools. Familiarity with SQL and other data query languages is an asset.
Power BI: 2+ years of hands-on experience with Power Bi will be a plus.
Project Management: experience in project management methodologies such as Agile or Scrum.
Communication: excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with stakeholders at all levels. Comfortable working with business stakeholders across a range of data and analytics experience.
Experience in conducting business process owner interviews, facilitating requirement gathering sessions, documenting functional data model, and creating user stories.
Ability to translate technical concepts into business language.
Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical thinking to identify business needs and propose effective solutions.
Experience working in a regional (multi-country) or global role.
Familiarity with the food/agriculture industry, as this can help in understanding specific business requirements and processes.
Customer focused, collaborative, entrepreneurial, and have a result driven mindset.
Aware of data best practices and able to identify areas of opportunity.
An excellent communicator, with the ability to translate business needs into data solutions.
Accountable and have a ‚Äúget things done‚Äù attitude. This role is about supporting change, finding solutions and getting your business leaders the data they need to make informed decisions.
‚ÄúHands-on‚Äù with data mapping, dashboard design, and working with the technology team to deliver on data initiatives.


About McCain.

Click Here to learn more about McCain and how we provide you with opportunities to make an impact that matters.

Leadership principles.

At McCain, our leadership principles guide how we engage with customers, collaborate as a team, and achieve success. We focus on understanding customer needs, driving innovation, empowering people, and taking ownership to clear obstacles and deliver results.

The McCain Experience.

We are McCain. This statement is a testament to our collective strength and our individual value. Your contributions play a vital role in our success. Our winning culture is rooted in authenticity and trust, empowering us to bring out the best in one another. Here, you‚Äôll find opportunities to learn, grow, and thrive. Join us and experience why we‚Äôre better together.

Compensation Package: $58,800.00 - $78,500.00 CAD annually + bonus eligibility

The above reflects the target compensation range for the position at the time of posting. Hiring compensation will be determined based on experience, skill set, education/training, and other organizational needs.

Benefits: At McCain, we‚Äôre on a mission to create a winning culture that puts employee safety and wellbeing at the heart of what we do, every day. We understand and appreciate that each person‚Äôs needs are unique and ensure our benefits & wellbeing programs reflect that. Employees are eligible for the following benefits: health coverage (medical, dental, vision, prescription drug), retirement savings benefits, and leave support including medical, family and bereavement. Wellbeing programs include vacation and holidays, company-supported volunteering time, and mental health resources. Coverages are aligned to country, provincial and state governing plans and can vary by work level, location and nature of the role. Additional benefit details available during the application process.

Your well-being matters to us, and we‚Äôre here to provide you with the necessary resources to support you in being your best self at work ‚Äî and at home.

McCain Foods is an equal opportunity employer. As a global family-owned company, we strive to be the employer of choice in the diverse communities around the world in which we live and work. We recognize that inclusion drives our creativity, resilience, and success and makes our business stronger. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.

McCain is an accessible employer. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials or accessible meeting rooms), please let us know and we will work with you to find appropriate solutions.

Your privacy is important to us. By submitting personal data or information to us, you agree this will be handled in accordance with McCain‚Äôs Global Privacy Policy and Global Employee Privacy Policy, as applicable. You can understand how your personal information is being handled here.

Title: Data Analyst III
Description:
Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills:




1. 5+ years proficiency in Power BI: Advanced knowledge of Power BI for creating dashboards, reports, and visualizations.

2. 2+ years experience in Data Modeling: Expertise in data modeling, including the creation and optimization of data models to enhance performance and usability.

3. DAX (Data Analysis Expressions): Strong command of DAX for building complex calculations and aggregations.

4. Power Query/M: 5+ years experience with Power Query for data transformation and cleaning.

5. SQL: Ability to write complex SQL queries for data retrieval and manipulation from various databases, minimum 5 years experience.

6. ETL Processes: Understanding of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools to integrate data from different sources.

7. Programing language: Proficiency in some programing language like python (Understanding of data types, variables, loops, conditionals, and error handling. Familiarity with Python's standard library and commonly used modules.)

8. Data Warehousing: Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and practices.

9. Project Management: Experience leading BI projects, including planning, execution, and delivery and managing/maintaining the project backlog with stakeholders.




Nice to Have Skills:

1. Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate or relevant Power BI certifications to demonstrate proficiency and expertise.

2. Power Automate

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD86582

Position Overview

We are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in Canada. This is a hybrid full-time role, reporting to the Sr. Manager of Customer Analytics. As a Business Intelligence Analyst Specialist, your primary responsibility will be to provide valuable insights into user behavior, their product usage patterns, and identifying opportunities for growth. You will help create dashboards, reports, and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to the stakeholders. Furthermore, you will use your expertise in creating and editing visual content, including maps, charts, and graphs, and transforming data sets into visually compelling visuals. You will also provide visual, technical, and editorial guidance to ensure the highest quality of data visualizations.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with teams to understand business needs and requirements for data analysis
Design and develop data models, dashboards, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders
Create and edit visual content, including maps, charts, and graphs, to provide visual representations of data insights
Transform quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals that effectively communicate important information
Use advanced statistical techniques to analyze and interpret complex datasets
Provide expert-level visual, technical, and editorial guidance to ensure the highest quality of data visualizations
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in data analysis and visualization techniques
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data visualization needs and provide recommendations on the most effective visual representation of data
Conduct quality checks on visual content to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to brand guidelines
Communicate complex data insights through visually compelling presentations and reports, tailored to different audiences


Minimum Requirements


Bachelor's/ Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
5+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role
Expertise in statistical analysis, data modelling, and data visualisation
Proficiency in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or D3.js
Experience working with large datasets and proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
Samples / examples showcasing previous data analysis and visualization projects


Learn More

When you‚Äôre an Autodesker, you can do meaningful work that helps build a better world designed and made for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

  • Azure Data Tools (Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Studio, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Synapse Analytics)
  • Writing Requirements
  • ETL

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
Job ID: 58267

Job Category: Policy, Planning & Research

Division & Section: Toronto Building, Tor Bldg Business Operations

Work Location: City Hall, 100 Queen St. West

Job Type & Duration: Permanent, Full-Time (Hybrid)

Salary: $94,905.00 - $128,386.00, TM2202, Wage Grade 6.5

Shift Information: Monday to Friday, 35 hours per week

Affiliation: Non-Union

Number of Positions Open: 2

Posting Period: 28-JUL-2025 to 12-AUG-2025




Toronto Building has a bold ambition to become a modern, client-centric regulator that helps the City achieve its strategic objectives through partnership, innovation and regulatory excellence. As Canada's largest municipal building regulator, the Division is critical to Toronto's success and prosperity. Its core services ‚Äî issuing building permits and inspecting construction ‚Äî ensure that Toronto's built environment is safe, accessible, and sustainable. These services also play a critical role in delivering many of Toronto's city-building priorities, including affordable housing.




Reporting to the Manager of Business Planning Performance and Intelligence, you will help develop and maintain Toronto Building‚Äôs business intelligence environment. You will consolidate data from a number of internal and external sources, prepare it for analysis, run queries against the data and create data visualizations, BI dashboards and reports to make the analytics results available to business users for operational decision-making and strategic planning.




Major Responsibilities:

Implements detailed plans and recommends procedures regarding program specific requirements.
Conducts research into assigned area ensuring that such research takes into account developments within the field, corporate policies and practices, legislation and initiatives by other levels of government.
Provides input into and administers assigned budget, ensuring that expenditures are controlled and maintained within approved budget limitations.
Maintains Business Intelligence Environment.
Creates reports and consults with the Managers regarding data collection findings and recommendations.
Develops and designs business and performance measures dashboards.
Creates decision support information from operational systems, surveys and third party data sources.
Responds to ad hoc information requests through sourcing and reporting the highest quality information possible in a timely manner.
Works on research projects and data mining, including trends analysis.
Assists with business intelligence program development integrating data that supports performance management, case management, outcome reporting.
Supports senior management in the interpretation of performance/outcome data and creates connections between analyses to provide insight into achievements and underperformance at an office, team and caseworker level. Develops performance measures and provides input into measures to support strategic objectives.
Develops service standards and performance measures to guide proactive development of new products and/or processes.
Develops programs and queries and other data for labour relations and performance related issues. Oversees sensitive data and follows all privacy protocols regarding information storage and extraction.
Maintains a data dictionary of all valid, tested and repeatable data constructs, data objects and information products.
Develops, implements and applies sound information management standards, procedures and tools to provide consistent, accurate, timely information.
Identifies, prioritizes and develops data products suitable for disclosure or contribution to enterprise open data repositories.
Develops and produces information publications such as annual reports.
Liaises with information providers throughout the City and other service providers and municipalities to develop and share information and data definitions.
Liaises with business users and developers to ensure effective communication and addressing production data and application issues.
Prepares and delivers presentations, performance measurement and benchmarking reports and data to staff, the public, external agencies, and community organizations.
Develops the teams' knowledge base and oversees the continuous learning required in the Business Intelligence field.
Provides recommendations that contribute to divisional/City initiatives and the effective use of human/fiscal/IT assets and services that will lead to service efficiencies and optimization of resources.
Prepares reports for management in relation to changes in business technology solutions, business methods/processes including appropriate resource allocation.
Oversees projects on the execution and completion of assigned projects (i.e. defines purpose, objectives, project activities, milestones and deliverables, monitors work performance and tracks progress to ensure project goals and time lines are met).
Reports caseload and performance measures to the City's management dashboard and FPARS.
Creates contingency plans for both business and system interruptions and supports business continuity planning.
Oversees the development and delivery of information and research support for Service Plans, policies and Council reports for all program areas in the division
Develops risk mitigation plans and forecasts related to impacts from policy, budget and regulation changes.




Key Qualifications:

Your application for the role of Business Intelligence Consultant must describe your qualifications as they relate to:

Post-secondary education in a relevant discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Analysis, Business Administration, Engineering or related field) or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience; Master's degree is preferred.
Considerable experience in Business Intelligence and Business Analytics.
Considerable experience with Structured Query Language (SQL) programing, query design and developing scripts and reporting.
Considerable experience with maintaining data warehouse environment and with strong knowledge of ETL (extract/transform/load) concepts and processes.
Considerable experience with Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, SSRS, OLAP tools) along with experience in creating dashboards and data visualization for different audiences.
Experience in developing Performance Management frameworks, Key Performance Measures and Indicators.
Must possess or be able to obtain the following Ministry of Municipal Affairs & Housing Ontario Building Code qualification: Powers and Duties of a Chief Building Official (Legal).
Aptitude and interest in Python, R, .NET Technology, XML/XSLT, JavaScript would be considered an asset.
Ability designing and delivering formal group training and presentations.
Excellent strategic and lateral thinking skills in combination with strong research, analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and conflict resolution skills.
Exceptional interpersonal and negotiation skills with the ability to establish positive working relationships and interact and communicate effectively with employees, divisional and corporate staff, outside agencies/and or politicians, other levels of government and members of the public.




Equity, Diversity and Inclusion

The City is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace culture of inclusiveness that reflects the diverse residents that we serve. Learn more about the City‚Äôs commitment to employment equity.

Accommodation

The City of Toronto is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive organization. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require Code-protected accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to meet your needs. Disability-related accommodation during the application process is available upon request. Learn more about the City‚Äôs Hiring Policies and Accommodation Process.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
OUR STORY

Quince was started to challenge the existing idea that nice things should cost a lot. Our mission was simple: create an item of equal or greater quality than the leading luxury brands and sell them at a much lower price.

OUR VALUES

Customer First. Customer satisfaction is our highest priority.

High Quality. True quality is a combination of premium materials and high production standards that everyone can feel good about.

Essential design. We don't chase trends, and we don't sell everything. We're expert curators that find the very best and bring it to you at the lowest prices.

Always a better deal. Through innovation and real price transparency we want to offer the best deal to both our customers and our factory partners.

Environmentally and Socially conscious. We're committed to sustainable materials and sustainable production methods. That means a cleaner environment and fair wages for factory workers.

OUR TEAM AND SUCCESS

Quince is a retail and technology company co-founded by a team that has extensive experience in retail, technology and building early stage companies. You'll work with a team of world-class talent from Stanford GSB, Google, D.E. Shaw, Stitch Fix, Urban Outfitters, Wayfair, McKinsey, Nike etc.

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE:

As an eCommerce Data Analyst, you'll play a critical role in planning, measuring, analyzing, optimizing our marketing, operations and revenue driving programs for our Canada market. You'll work closely with our performance marketing, data, merchandising and product teams to deliver data-driven insights and strategic recommendations. Your expertise in analyzing large datasets, interpreting trends, and translating them into actionable insights will help us make smarter, faster, and more effective marketing decisions.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Analyze customer behavior, conversion funnels, and on-site metrics (e.g., CTR, CVR, bounce rate) to identify opportunities to improve product discovery and conversion.
Provide cross-channel marketing insights (paid search, social, display, email, affiliate) to optimize campaigns and drive ROAS, CAC, and LTV goals.
Partner with merchandising to uncover bundling trends, product affinities, and inventory insights that inform upsell and cross-sell strategies.
Design and evaluate A/B and incrementality tests to optimize creative, targeting, and media mix performance.
Forecast marketing and revenue performance for weekly, monthly, and quarterly planning cycles.
Build dashboards and automate reporting to deliver real-time insights for marketing, merchandising, and leadership teams.
Monitor inventory demand alignment to prevent stock outs from impacting campaign success.
Perform ad hoc analysis and post-mortems to quantify business impact and inform future marketing and site strategies.
Conduct deep-dive analysis of Canadian customer behavior and attribution to surface local growth opportunities in acquisition, retention, and cross-sell.


REQUIREMENTS:


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, or similar). Master's degree is a plus.
5+ years in a data analytics role, ideally with a focus on performance or digital marketing within an e-commerce or technology company.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BIm Mixpanel).
Knowledge of statistical analysis and A/B testing; familiarity with Python or R is a plus.
Ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable insights, with a focus on detail, accuracy, and clarity.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present data insights and recommendations effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Based in Toronto with the ability to come into the Toronto office 4 days per week.


Quince provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applications for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

If you require reasonable accommodation during any part of the application or interview process, please contact accommodations@onequince.com. We are committed to ensuring an inclusive and accessible hiring process for all candidates.

Security Advisory: Beware of Frauds

At Quince, we're dedicated to recruiting top talent who share our drive for innovation. To safeguard candidates, Quince emphasizes legitimate recruitment practices. Initial communication is primarily via official Quince email addresses and LinkedIn; beware of deviations. Personal data and sensitive information will not be solicited during the application phase. Interviews are conducted via phone, in person, or through the approved platforms Google Meets or Zoom‚Äînever via messaging apps or other calling services. Offers are merit-based, communicated verbally, and followed up in writing. If personal information is requested to initiate the hiring process, rest assured it will be through secure and protected means.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What We Do:

Children‚Äôs Treatment Network (CTN) supports over 33,000 kids and youth with disabilities and other developmental needs. We provide intake, service navigation and coordinated service planning, assessment and diagnostic services, specialized clinics and rehabilitation services, including physiotherapy, occupational therapy and speech language therapy.




Funded by the Ministry of Children, Community and Social Services, CTN is an Ontario provincial government funded not-for profit organization, that offers services through contracted partners in the education, health and community sectors. Through its innovative network model, CTN‚Äôs commitment to providing family-centered care is anchored by an electronic client record that is shared across its partner organizations and provides the foundation for integrated plans of care and services.




Dedicated to creating a vibrant community where all kids, youth and families belong, we have a strong commitment to equity, diversity, inclusion, Indigeneity and accessibility. With this in mind, our goal is a workforce that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome all qualified applicants to apply including individuals with disabilities, those who identify as Black, Indigenous or persons of colour, members of the LGBTQ2S+ communities and others. We are proud to be in compliance with the¬†Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), 2005¬†and the¬†Integrated Accessibility Standards Regulation. We are happy to honour accommodations at any part of the recruitment process and invite you to let us know how we can help.




What We Offer:

Competitive compensation and employee benefits package including participation in the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP) and vacation/leave entitlement
An opportunity to contribute to the work of a not-for-profit organization that provides services to kids and youth with disabilities and developmental needs and their families
The chance to be a part of a culture with an organization that values inclusion, collaboration, responsibility, and innovation
The opportunity to work with us to achieve CTN‚Äôs strategic goals of putting people at the centre of what we do, striving for excellence, fostering a culture of accountability and stewardship to support community needs, and transformation through equitable data-driven service innovation




What You Will Do:

CTN is looking for a permanent, full-time Data Analyst who will provide technical, analytical, and data services that will significantly contribute to quality, measurement, and evaluation activities at CTN. This position reports to the Manager, Quality, Measurement and Evaluation.




Responsibilities:

The successful incumbent will be responsible for the following duties and responsibilities:

Develop and coordinate work plans and inputs for projects related to strategic, operational, and network planning, quality improvement, risk management, knowledge transfer, balanced score cards, and performance monitoring and measurement
Design, test, or source data collection strategies and tools
Facilitate and undertake data collection, analysis and reporting to support CTN quality, measurement, and evaluation initiatives, involving output, outcome, and performance measurement
Provide expertise and training to staff in the recording, monitoring, and reporting of data for programs and services, and establish, maintain, and produce databases/spreadsheets and formal data analysis reports
Collect, analyze, interpret, and present data in reports, presentations, and related documents in written and/or digital formats
Ensure monthly and quarterly data reporting for performance metrics and board reporting are completed for month-end, quarterly and year-end reporting
Review data trends over time and assist the key affected parties with interpretations and investigation of trends, outputs, outcomes, and quality improvement
Engage and liaise with CTN leadership and teams to understand, monitor, and report on program, organizational and network level data
Anticipate organizational needs and proactively develop solutions to support those needs
Validate and share data and accompanying context and insights to develop a shared understanding of data for various key affected groups to inform organizational decision making
Engage, liaise, and provide consultation with members of the leadership team and other data requestors with responsibilities for data and results
Investigate data inconsistencies and the interpretation of data and use the results to make recommendations to improve data quality
Bridge data from multiple sources including the shared electronic records, performance and quality metrics, and primary and secondary research to inform fulsome analysis, communication, and storytelling
Possess a strong capability to explain and verify all data analyses completed to promote data literacy amongst CTN employees
Lead the development of primary data collection using mixed methods including surveys, focus groups and interviews for quality, measurement, and evaluation activities
Review, analyze, interpret, and make recommendations on methods, results/data and other information collected throughout the network
Conduct secondary research including literature searches to support leadership decisions
Participate as a data expert resource on committees, work groups and task forces as assigned by leadership
Collaborate with team members to participate in driving the CTN IT data strategy at the program, organization, and network levels
Work collaboratively with Information Management and Health Records functions to maintain integrity and security of all CTN aligned data sets
Support the leadership team and other employees in various assignments and functions requiring data development and analysis
Undertake other tasks as assigned by the Manager, Quality, Measurement and Evaluation
Take every precaution reasonable in the circumstances for the protection of themselves and other workers at CTN; and reports situations related to health and safety or data breaches to the supervisor
Take every reasonable precaution in the circumstances for the protection of clients at CTN when becomes aware of the existence of any potential danger to client safety




Other Support

Work with a continuous quality improvement lens and uphold ethics related to data collection and research
Provide excellent customer service to all internal and external customers
Adhere to Privacy legislation respecting the privacy of clients and families
Ensure legal compliance to the Employee Standards Act of Ontario, Ontario Health & Safety Act, and other regulations and best practices
Other duties and projects as required




What We Need:

A minimum of three-year University Degree in an area that is aligned with Human and Health Services with a significant focus on statistical applications OR a three-year Community College diploma in Analytical Research or Data Analytics or a related field is required
A minimum of three years experience in data analysis and/or performance monitoring and measurement, preferably in the community, social or health sectors is required
Technical knowledge of computer hardware and software set-up and configuration. Knowledge of standard statistical software packages (i.e., SPSS)
Designing, developing, and maintaining databases/spreadsheets (Excel, SQL, etc.)
Excellent understanding of research, data analysis, and evaluation concepts
Demonstrated competency in research methodologies and tools (e.g., surveys, focus group)
Demonstrated business professionalism with respect to confidentiality, the ability to recognize sensitivity and exercise good judgement, discretion, and accountability in all aspects of the role
Strong organizational skills in the use of time with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple priorities in a high-pressure fast-paced environment
Ability to work as a team using a problem-solving approach with other team members; always working to move the team towards the achievement of its goals, build its capacity and create an environment of consensus and collaboration
Highly proficient skills in the use of Microsoft Office
Ability to work flexible hours in support of requirements that may fall outside of the typical work hour framework
Knowledge of the children‚Äôs service systems in Simcoe County and York Region considered an asset
Lived experience as a person with a disability or a caregiver of a child with a disability and/or developmental needs is considered an asset
Ability to communicate in French or other languages considered an asset
Experience with and understanding of various cultures and cultural communities including Francophone, First Nations, M√©tis and Inuit (FNMI) communities considered an asset
Certified First Aid considered an asset
Demonstrated commitment to a safe environment for staff, clients and families by working in compliance with the Occupational Health & Safety Act and related policies




Selected Successful Candidate Will Be Required To:

Produce a clear police record check with a vulnerable sector check prior to start of employment
Be able to travel to assigned office, between CTN sites and/or other locations as required
Maintain the ability to work effectively in a temporary hybrid environment and have access to appropriate internet capacity
Be able to provide supporting documentation to confirm your eligibility to legally work within Canada




Office Location:

Richmond Hill or Barrie




Starting Salary: $69,044

Salary Range: $69,044 - $76,716

CTN‚Äôs total rewards package includes competitive compensation and employee benefits package including participation in the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP), generous vacation entitlements, and the opportunity for hybrid work.

¬†

To Apply:

1. Submit your resume to careers@ctnsy.ca

2. Quote Job ID # JL-004 in the subject line of email




Applications are accepted from July 31, 2025 ‚Äì August 14, 2025.




Thank you for your interest in this opportunity!

The successful incumbent will be responsible for the following duties and responsibilities:

  • Develop and coordinate work plans and inputs for projects related to strategic, operational, and network planning, quality improvement, risk management, knowledge transfer, balanced score cards, and performance monitoring and measurement
  • Design, test, or source data collection strategies and tools
  • Facilitate and undertake data collection, analysis and reporting to support CTN quality, measurement, and evaluation initiatives, involving output, outcome, and performance measurement
  • Provide expertise and training to staff in the recording, monitoring, and reporting of data for programs and services, and establish, maintain, and produce databases/spreadsheets and formal data analysis reports
  • Collect, analyze, interpret, and present data in reports, presentations, and related documents in written and/or digital formats
  • Ensure monthly and quarterly data reporting for performance metrics and board reporting are completed for month-end, quarterly and year-end reporting
  • Review data trends over time and assist the key affected parties with interpretations and investigation of trends, outputs, outcomes, and quality improvement
  • Engage and liaise with CTN leadership and teams to understand, monitor, and report on program, organizational and network level data
  • Anticipate organizational needs and proactively develop solutions to support those needs
  • Validate and share data and accompanying context and insights to develop a shared understanding of data for various key affected groups to inform organizational decision making
  • Engage, liaise, and provide consultation with members of the leadership team and other data requestors with responsibilities for data and results
  • Investigate data inconsistencies and the interpretation of data and use the results to make recommendations to improve data quality
  • Bridge data from multiple sources including the shared electronic records, performance and quality metrics, and primary and secondary research to inform fulsome analysis, communication, and storytelling
  • Possess a strong capability to explain and verify all data analyses completed to promote data literacy amongst CTN employees
  • Lead the development of primary data collection using mixed methods including surveys, focus groups and interviews for quality, measurement, and evaluation activities
  • Review, analyze, interpret, and make recommendations on methods, results/data and other information collected throughout the network
  • Conduct secondary research including literature searches to support leadership decisions
  • Participate as a data expert resource on committees, work groups and task forces as assigned by leadership
  • Collaborate with team members to participate in driving the CTN IT data strategy at the program, organization, and network levels
  • Work collaboratively with Information Management and Health Records functions to maintain integrity and security of all CTN aligned data sets
  • Support the leadership team and other employees in various assignments and functions requiring data development and analysis
  • Undertake other tasks as assigned by the Manager, Quality, Measurement and Evaluation
  • Take every precaution reasonable in the circumstances for the protection of themselves and other workers at CTN; and reports situations related to health and safety or data breaches to the supervisor
  • Take every reasonable precaution in the circumstances for the protection of clients at CTN when becomes aware of the existence of any potential danger to client safety


Other Support

  • Work with a continuous quality improvement lens and uphold ethics related to data collection and research
  • Provide excellent customer service to all internal and external customers
  • Adhere to Privacy legislation respecting the privacy of clients and families
  • Ensure legal compliance to the Employee Standards Act of Ontario, Ontario Health & Safety Act, and other regulations and best practices
  • Other duties and projects as required


What We Need:

  • A minimum of three-year University Degree in an area that is aligned with Human and Health Services with a significant focus on statistical applications OR a three-year Community College diploma in Analytical Research or Data Analytics or a related field is required
  • A minimum of three years experience in data analysis and/or performance monitoring and measurement, preferably in the community, social or health sectors is required
  • Technical knowledge of computer hardware and software set-up and configuration. Knowledge of standard statistical software packages (i.e., SPSS)
  • Designing, developing, and maintaining databases/spreadsheets (Excel, SQL, etc.)
  • Excellent understanding of research, data analysis, and evaluation concepts
  • Demonstrated competency in research methodologies and tools (e.g., surveys, focus group)
  • Demonstrated business professionalism with respect to confidentiality, the ability to recognize sensitivity and exercise good judgement, discretion, and accountability in all aspects of the role
  • Strong organizational skills in the use of time with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple priorities in a high-pressure fast-paced environment
  • Ability to work as a team using a problem-solving approach with other team members; always working to move the team towards the achievement of its goals, build its capacity and create an environment of consensus and collaboration
  • Highly proficient skills in the use of Microsoft Office
  • Ability to work flexible hours in support of requirements that may fall outside of the typical work hour framework
  • Knowledge of the children‚Äôs service systems in Simcoe County and York Region considered an asset
  • Lived experience as a person with a disability or a caregiver of a child with a disability and/or developmental needs is considered an asset
  • Ability to communicate in French or other languages considered an asset
  • Experience with and understanding of various cultures and cultural communities including Francophone, First Nations, M√©tis and Inuit (FNMI) communities considered an asset
  • Certified First Aid considered an asset
  • Demonstrated commitment to a safe environment for staff, clients and families by working in compliance with the Occupational Health & Safety Act and related policies


Selected Successful Candidate Will Be Required To:

  • Produce a clear police record check with a vulnerable sector check prior to start of employment
  • Be able to travel to assigned office, between CTN sites and/or other locations as required
  • Maintain the ability to work effectively in a temporary hybrid environment and have access to appropriate internet capacity
  • Be able to provide supporting documentation to confirm your eligibility to legally work within Canada


Office Location:

Richmond Hill or Barrie


Starting Salary: $69,044

Salary Range: $69,044 - $76,716

CTN‚Äôs total rewards package includes competitive compensation and employee benefits package including participation in the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP), generous vacation entitlements, and the opportunity for hybrid work.

 

To Apply:

1. Submit your resume to careers@ctnsy.ca

2. Quote Job ID # JL-004 in the subject line of email


Applications are accepted from July 31, 2025 ‚Äì August 14, 2025.


Thank you for your interest in this opportunity!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a skilled Data Analyst passionate about leading the implementation and management of impactful data-driven solutions? Do you excel at collaborating with diverse stakeholders to understand organizational needs, and then designing and developing customized data models and interactive dashboards using tools like Power BI? Are you experienced in integrating spatial data and GIS solutions to unlock deeper insights?

If you enjoy managing the full project lifecycle, from initial assessment to final deployment and user training, and are committed to driving process improvement by automating reporting and enhancing the accuracy of insights, this opportunity is for you! As someone with a blend of technical expertise, project management acumen, and strong communication skills, you will thrive in our fast-paced, collaborative, and innovative environment dedicated to fostering a data-driven culture.

Your Opportunity

Dillon‚Äôs is looking for a Data Analyst to join our multidisciplinary team of professionals. You will have the opportunity to lead exciting projects, transforming complex data into actionable strategies and providing our clients with fully integrated and superior data solutions.

At Dillon, we operate as one team. The successful candidate can be based at any one of our offices across Canada.

We offer flexible work hours to help balance the competing demands of work and personal life.

Responsibilities

What Your Day Will Look Like

Client Enablement & Stakeholder Collaboration


Collaborate closely with a wide range of stakeholders, including senior leadership, IT departments, data scientists, and client teams, to assess organizational needs and define project scope.
Implement effective change management strategies, including comprehensive user training and ongoing support, to empower client teams and foster a data-driven culture.
Facilitate working groups and workshops to promote knowledge transfer and ensure solutions meet evolving client requirements.
Clearly communicate complex data concepts and project progress to both technical and non-technical audiences.



Project Leadership & Solution Delivery


Lead the implementation and management of data-driven solutions for clients, overseeing the full project lifecycle from initial assessment and requirements gathering to deployment, user training, and ongoing support.
Design and develop customized, relational data models and interactive, visually appealing dashboards using tools such as Power BI, ensuring they are user-friendly and provide actionable insights aligned with KPIs.
Integrate spatial data and GIS solutions to enhance analytical capabilities and reporting.
Ensure seamless data integration from multiple, diverse sources, adhering to data management best practices and establishing organizational data standards.
Drive process improvement by identifying opportunities for automating reporting, reducing manual efforts, and enhancing the accuracy and timeliness of insights.
Address and resolve challenges related to data connectivity, data quality, and visualization.



Learning and Development


Commit to self-development and ongoing learning and professional development
Contribute to Dillon‚Äôs corporate profile through active participation in professional associations and committees



Qualifications

What You Will Need To Succeed


A degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Business Analytics, or a related field.
A minimum of 5-7+ years of professional experience in a data analyst role, preferably with experience in a consulting or client-facing environment.
Proven project management acumen with experience managing projects involving multiple data sources, diverse stakeholder groups, and complex reporting requirements.
Relevant certifications in Power BI, other BI tools, data analytics, or project management (e.g., PMP) are highly desirable.



Experience


Proven experience in designing, developing, and implementing customized relational data models and interactive dashboards using Power BI (or similar BI tools like Tableau, Qlik).
Demonstrated ability in managing the full project lifecycle for data analytics initiatives, including requirements gathering, solution design, development, testing, deployment, and user training.
Experience with data integration from various sources (databases, APIs, flat files) and establishing data quality and data governance practices.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with data manipulation and analysis using Python or R is a strong asset.
Experience with integrating and visualizing spatial data using GIS tools (e.g., ArcGIS, QGIS) and techniques.
Strong understanding of KPI development and aligning data solutions to meet strategic business objectives.
Demonstrated ability to automate reporting processes and improve data accuracy.
Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly and persuasively to diverse audiences.
Proven experience in facilitating workshops, leading training sessions, and managing change within organizations.



Why Choose Dillon

Dillon is powered by people who are technically proficient, passionate about socially important projects, and motivated to deliver superior, tangible results. We strive to remain at the forefront of technology and innovation, and are empowered to continually grow and develop.

We live our core values :


Reliability: words result in actions that build trust;
Achievement: do the work to hit the target;
Continuous development: always learning; always adapting; always growing;
Creativity: discover new possibilities;
Courage: do the things that matter, especially when it‚Äôs hard;
Inclusiveness: enabling belonging to draw strength from our differences.



Dillon is a certified Great Place to Work . This recognition underscores our commitment to fostering an outstanding employee experience and cultivating an exceptional workplace culture. At Dillon, we believe that our people are our greatest asset. This designation reflects our ongoing efforts to ensure that our workplace is not just a place of work, but a community where everyone can thrive.

In addition, we offer:


Employee share purchase plan
Dillon is 100% employee owned and share ownership is open to all employees.
A competitive compensation package
Comprehensive health benefits
Generous retirement savings plan
Student loan repayment assistance with matching employer contributions
Flexible work hours and hybrid working options
Dillon values its staff and the contributions that are made each day and understands that work arrangements can differ based on personal needs and business needs. We are taking a trust-based approach to oÔ¨Äer a variety of Ô¨Çexible and hybrid work options to help balance the competing demands of work and personal life.
Learning and Development opportunities
As a knowledge-based business, the organic growth of our knowledge and skills occur through our work performance and roles. The creation and sharing of knowledge allows us to take local knowledge to scale, capture lessons learned through experience, and continuously improve service delivery. The development of self and others is an evident and measured core behaviour within our organization
We use a composite approach to development including coaching to build the how, mentoring to share lessons, advising to round out perspectives, and co-creation of knowledge through internal learning opportunities.
Focus on Innovation
The ability to anticipate, examine, and adopt new and innovative solutions is a crucial driver for the continual and progressive advancement of our business performance. In our culture, people are empowered to reflect and question current practices and seek forward looking solutions to today‚Äôs problems and tomorrow‚Äôs opportunities.
Employee and Family Assistance program
A variety of EFAP tools and online resources to support well-being are available to all employees.
Goodlife Fitness Corporate Membership
Our employees can take advantage of reduced annual membership fees.
Wellness Subsidy
Our employees can take advantage of a wellness subsidy that can be put towards expenses for a variety of health and/or wellness related activities such as gym membership, purchase of home fitness equipment, yoga classes and dance classes.

About Dillon

Dillon is a proudly Canadian, employee-owned, professional consulting firm specializing in planning, engineering, environmental science, and management. We partner with clients to provide committed, collaborative, and inventive solutions to complex, multi-faceted projects. With over 20 offices and more than 1000 employees across Canada, Dillon offers a wide range of services related to building and improving facilities and infrastructure, protecting the environment, and developing communities.

Now operating for over 75 years, we continue to strive for excellence in everything we do. Dillon has been listed as one of Canada‚Äôs Best Managed Companies for the past 18 years and has the distinction of having achieved Platinum Club member status in this program.

Employment Equity, Diversity & Inclusion at Dillon

Dillon is committed to the principles of employment equity, inclusiveness, and diversity within our organization. We strive to achieve a workplace where opportunities are based on skills and abilities and that respects and values differences.

Inclusion is more than a word to us, it is the way we choose to run our business. We encourage you to contact us if you require accommodation during the interview process. We would love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Here‚Äôs your opportunity to join a growing company in the rapidly evolving health care sector! Spectrum Health Care is currently seeking a dynamic Data Analyst. The successful candidate will support critical functions by analyzing large datasets to derive actionable insights that enhance clinical, operational, and financial outcomes.

This position offers the opportunity to work at the intersection of healthcare and technology, leveraging data to inform decisions that directly impact patient care, service delivery, and agency performance.

With over 40 years of experience delivering innovative home health care and specialized services, Spectrum Health Care is blazing a trail of positive health system change. If you have a passion for data analytics and can translate findings into actionable insights, we want you on our team!

Job Description


Data Collection, Management & Integration ‚Äì Collect and manage healthcare data from various sources, ensuring data integrity and transforming raw data into structured, accurate formats for analysis.
Data Analysis & Insights Generation -- Analyze healthcare datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that improve patient care and drive operational efficiency.
Predictive Analytics & Decision Support: Develop predictive models to forecast patient needs, healthcare utilization patterns, or risk stratification. Support decision-making by leveraging data to predict patient trends, optimize scheduling, allocate resources effectively, and provide real-time actionable insights and optimization strategies.
Data Reporting & Communication: Create automated reports and dashboards to provide ongoing visibility to performance metrics, quality outcomes, and clinical KPIs. Prepare reports for regulatory agencies, payers, and external partners, ensuring compliance with local, state, and federal health regulations, as well as data-sharing requirements.
Data Governance & Compliance: Ensure compliance with healthcare regulations including PHIPA, PIPEDA, Law 25. Implement and maintain data governance frameworks ensuring proper access control, security, and compliance and develop policies for data accuracy, audit trails, and governance.
Collaboration & Continuous Improvement: Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and provide data-driven recommendations. Collaborate on quality improvement projects and contribute to training and education of team members helping them better understand the significance of data analysis and fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization.
Performance Metrics & Benchmarking: Develop and track performance metrics to monitor the effectiveness of healthcare programs, patient care delivery, and operational efficiencies. Conduct benchmarking studies to compare internal performance against industry standards, best practices, or competitor organizations, highlighting areas for improvement.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Data Science, Healthcare Analytics, Health Informatics, Public Health, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
A Master‚Äôs Degree in Healthcare Analytics, Public Health, or Data Science is preferred but not required.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on healthcare data or healthcare-related sectors
Proven experience with healthcare-specific data sources and systems, such as Electronic Health Records (EHR)
Experience in data integration from multiple healthcare platforms and external data sources (e.g., public health databases, government reports).
Advanced proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, R, Python, SAS, or Excel for data manipulation, statistical analysis, and automation.
Experience with business intelligence (BI) tools like Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, or similar, for creating interactive dashboards and data visualizations.
Experience in predictive analytics, machine learning, or artificial intelligence applied to healthcare data.
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Microsoft Azure for storing and processing large healthcare datasets.
Knowledge of data warehousing, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, and data modeling techniques to organize and maintain large datasets efficiently.
Familiarity with machine learning and predictive analytics methods is a plus, particularly in healthcare forecasting and risk stratification.
Strong understanding of healthcare compliance regulations (e.g., PHIPA, PIPEDA) and experience implementing data security best practices in alignment with industry standards such as ITIL and ISO.


Additional Information

Spectrum Health Care is thrilled to be named one of Canada‚Äôs Best Managed Companies. This award recognizes top companies across Canada for overall performance, sustained growth, strategy, capabilities and innovation, culture and commitment, and leadership. Click here to learn more about this esteemed honour.

We thank all applicants, however, only those individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act 2005, upon request, support will be provided for accommodations throughout the recruitment process.

If you require accommodation because of disability through the recruitment process, please contact Human Resources at (corphr@spectrumhealthcare.com) for assistance.

Spectrum Health Care is committed to fostering, cultivating and building a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion within our organization. We strive to attract, engage and develop a workforce that reflects the diverse communities that we serve and we know a diverse workforce is key to the growth and success of our organization.

  • 3+ years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on healthcare data or healthcare-related sectors
  • Proven experience with healthcare-specific data sources and systems, such as Electronic Health Records (EHR)
  • Experience in data integration from multiple healthcare platforms and external data sources (e.g., public health databases, government reports).
  • Advanced proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, R, Python, SAS, or Excel for data manipulation, statistical analysis, and automation.
  • Experience with business intelligence (BI) tools like Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, or similar, for creating interactive dashboards and data visualizations.
  • Experience in predictive analytics, machine learning, or artificial intelligence applied to healthcare data.
  • Familiarity with cloud computing platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Microsoft Azure for storing and processing large healthcare datasets.
  • Knowledge of data warehousing, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, and data modeling techniques to organize and maintain large datasets efficiently.
  • Familiarity with machine learning and predictive analytics methods is a plus, particularly in healthcare forecasting and risk stratification.
  • Strong understanding of healthcare compliance regulations (e.g., PHIPA, PIPEDA) and experience implementing data security best practices in alignment with industry standards such as ITIL and ISO.

Additional Information

Spectrum Health Care is thrilled to be named one of Canada‚Äôs Best Managed Companies. This award recognizes top companies across Canada for overall performance, sustained growth, strategy, capabilities and innovation, culture and commitment, and leadership. Click here to learn more about this esteemed honour.

We thank all applicants, however, only those individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act 2005, upon request, support will be provided for accommodations throughout the recruitment process.

If you require accommodation because of disability through the recruitment process, please contact Human Resources at (corphr@spectrumhealthcare.com) for assistance.

Spectrum Health Care is committed to fostering, cultivating and building a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion within our organization. We strive to attract, engage and develop a workforce that reflects the diverse communities that we serve and we know a diverse workforce is key to the growth and success of our organization.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Join our Global Technology Strategy team!

This role offers a unique opportunity to lead data analytics initiatives that directly influence strategy and enterprise enablement. As a key contributor to the executive team to provide reporting and strategic reviews, you‚Äôll help shape data-driven decisions across technology, finance, procurement, and operations.

This position will drive data processes to enhance through reporting automation and advanced analytics, while collaborating with multi-functional teams. You‚Äôll gain exposure to high-impact projects and develop insights that support the organization‚Äôs mission to deliver smarter, more efficient outcomes.

Position Responsibilities


Design and maintain executive-level dashboards and reports using tools such as Power BI, SQL, Excel, and Planview to deliver actionable insights.
Drive process automation and continuous improvement in analytics workflows to improve efficiency, accuracy, and scalability.
Collaborate with team members across departments to define critical metrics, scope analytics projects, and align data strategies with business goals.
Apply advanced analytics techniques, including machine learning and predictive modelling, to uncover trends to facilitate business and operational planning.
Communicate complex data findings clearly and effectively to senior leadership and business partners to support data-driven decisions.


Required Qualifications


Demonstrated ability in data analytics, business intelligence, or technology strategy roles.
Experience in leading and driving data presentation; discussions with executive leaders and present clear data stories.
Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience with tools such as Power BI, SQL, Excel, JIRA, and Planview for data analysis, reporting, and process automation.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Business Analytics, or a related field; Master‚Äôs degree preferred.
Familiarity with enterprise data environments, including data warehousing, ETL processes, and executive-level reporting.


Preferred Qualifications


Other certifications in analytics and/or project management.


When You Join Our Team


We‚Äôll empower you to learn and grow the career you want.
We‚Äôll recognize and support you in a flexible environment where well-being and inclusion are more than just words.
As part of our global team, we‚Äôll support you in shaping the future you want to see.


About Manulife And John Hancock

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services provider, helping people make their decisions easier and lives better. To learn more about us, visit https://www.manulife.com/en/about/our-story.html.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

Referenced Salary Location

Toronto, Ontario

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Salary range is expected to be between

$71,925.00 CAD - $119,875.00 CAD

If you are applying for this role outside of the primary location, please contact recruitment@manulife.com for the salary range for your location. The actual salary will vary depending on local market conditions, geography and relevant job-related factors such as knowledge, skills, qualifications, experience, and education/training. Employees also have the opportunity to participate in incentive programs and earn incentive compensation tied to business and individual performance.

Manulife offers eligible employees a wide array of customizable benefits, including health, dental, mental health, vision, short- and long-term disability, life and AD&D insurance coverage, adoption/surrogacy and wellness benefits, and employee/family assistance plans. We also offer eligible employees various retirement savings plans (including pension and a global share ownership plan with employer matching contributions) and financial education and counseling resources. Our generous paid time off program in Canada includes holidays, vacation, personal, and sick days, and we offer the full range of statutory leaves of absence. If you are applying for this role in the U.S., please contact recruitment@manulife.com for more information about U.S.-specific paid time off provisions.

Title: Data Analyst Intern, Controlling (12 Months)
Description:
A GOOD INTERNSHIP IS NEVER HANDS OFF.

SHARE YOUR PASSION.

Success requires teamwork. When experts share their knowledge and passion, ideas can develop quickly. This is what we call a good environment for innovation and that‚Äôs why we provide students and recent graduates an opportunity to not only listen, but also the opportunity to drive the business forward. We encourage you to bring your own ideas to the table ‚Äì and give you the opportunity to really show what you can do.

BMW Group Financial Services Canada is offering an internship, within its Controlling team. By design, the Controlling team is structured to provide functions within Financial Services, while also ensuring alignment with other functions. The high priority projects are (1) supporting new business development (2) enhancing the retailer and customer experience by leveraging data and customer experience and (3) data optimization project which is designed to increase data awareness, improve data access and reduce barriers to entry for those without a traditional data background.

What to expect?


You will be working out of the BMW Financial Services‚Äô corporate HQ which is based out of Richmond Hill, Ontario.
Opportunity and expectation to learn, collaborate and share new ideas and skills.
A team that is highly invested in your personal and professional development.
Position to lead and enhance an organization undergoing a data transformation and operational efficiency.
Exposure and involvement in a wide range of business topics ‚Äì from Financial Reporting, Risk, Remarketing and Overall business performance.
Fast-paced and high impact team environment.
Providing meaningful input into critical business decisions.
Freedom to develop and shape new reporting, analysis and the execution of department objectives.


Specific Responsibilities Include


Gathering data from source tables using self or pre-developed SQL scripts.
Managing internal reporting databases and meeting monthly reporting deadlines.
Development or enhancement of new reports that drive business decisions.
Application of mathematical and analytical frameworks to help drive sound business decisions with ability to document approach and back-test results.
Creating data visualizations in Tableau and Excel.
Driving automation of reports and ensuring data accuracy.
Engaging with other teams to support Internal Control System (ICS) process map updates, internal control point validation and testing.
Supporting members of the Controlling team with ongoing tasks or ad-hoc projects, as required.


Qualifications


Current student or recent graduate majoring in Finance/Accounting, Business Administraton related majors preferred. Additional studies in Statistics, Data Science, Data Analytics is considered an asset.
Experience within Business Intelligence, Financial Services, Business Development or Accounting.
Proven ability to visualize and present data within Tableau/Powerpoint.
Strong knowledge in MS Office, particularly Excel, PowerPoint and Visio as a plus.
Experience in a coding language; in particular working level experience in SQL is preferred.
Scripting or using ‚Äòdrag and drop‚Äô databasing programs (such as SQL SSMS, MS Access, SAS, Hyperion, etc) is nice to have.
Analytical, pragmatic and skilled in visualizing data (both structure and end product).
Willing to learn new skills, with no hesitation to dig into fine details.
Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Teamwork and communication skills.
Open to both receiving and providing feedback.
CPA/CFA candidates are preferred.


Benefits Of Working At BMW Group Canada Include


An award-winning culture.
Cutting edge innovation and creativity.
Flexible working models. **
World-class office space.
Fresh & nutritious meals in our amazing fully staffed, and subsidized, onsite cafeteria.
Fully stocked coffee/tea bar.
We encourage interested candidates who may legally work in Canada to apply for the role. Our organization follows a hybrid work structure. To be eligible for this role, candidates are expected to work from our Head Office in Richmond Hill, Ontario three times in a week.


BMW Group Canada is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse team of associates and creating an inclusive environment. BMW Group Canada does not discriminate against applicants based on race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or disability or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, provincial or territorial law.
Show more
